analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid dang dbyer med par byin gyi rlabs dang ldan zhing /
translated: they possess the blessing of being inseparable from the Sugata.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub myur du 'grub bar 'gyur ba kho na yin te /🔽de la gang gi dus na lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i shes pa skyes pa na gzhan du tha mal gyi rnam par rtog pa nyams su @185a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub myur du 'grub bar 'gyur ba kho na yin te / de la gang gi dus na lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i shes pa skyes pa na gzhan du tha mal gyi rnam par rtog pa nyams su @185a * //
translated: They will definitely quickly accomplish unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, when the consciousness endowed with deity yoga arises, it is not experienced as an ordinary thought.

original: de la 'dir de'i dus su sgye bar mi rtog pa las tha mal gyi ngo bo yod pa nyid do zhe na de lta na ni mi dmigs pa'i dngos po mtha' dag yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir de'i dus su sgye bar mi rtog pa las tha mal gyi ngo bo yod pa nyid do zhe na de lta na ni mi dmigs pa'i dngos po mtha' dag yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if at that time the nature of an ordinary thought exists, then it follows that all unapprehended things exist.

original: de ni shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni shes par mi nus so //
translated: That cannot be known.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog btsam gyis 'ching bar mi nus shing de'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor kun du bzang po'i ye shes las byung ba'i 'od zer phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa las byang chub thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog btsam gyis 'ching bar mi nus shing de'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor kun du bzang po'i ye shes las byung ba'i 'od zer phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa las byang chub thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, mere conceptual thought that is devoid of entity cannot bind. Therefore, one attains enlightenment through the meditation of the great seal that arises from the pristine wisdom of the good spiritual warrior who is free from conceptual thought.

original: de yang gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las /
translated: Moreover, the Guhyasamaja Tantra states:

original: phyag rgya gang gi cho ga yis //🔽bskal pa bye ba grangs med du //
analyzed: phyag rgya gang gi cho ga yis // bskal pa bye ba grangs med du //
translated: By the ritual of the great seal,

original: thob dka' ba yi sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: thob dka' ba yi sangs rgyas te //
translated: The buddhahood that is difficult to attain🔽Even in countless millions of eons,

original: tshe 'di nyid la thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Will be attained in this very lifetime.

original: de bas na rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor nas brtsams nas /
translated: Therefore, beginning with the yoga of one's deity,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the characteristics of all phenomena.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i yid la byed pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i yid la byed pa la ltos nas /
translated: In this way, in dependence on right mental activity,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes phul du byung ba'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang de mos pa yid la byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis sangs rgyas su dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes phul du byung ba'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang de mos pa yid la byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis sangs rgyas su dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat has declared that the yogin who is intent on the perfection of the Buddha's wisdom and the Buddha himself are undifferentiated and equal.

original: gzhan du bye brag tu byed pas ni bde bar gshegs pa yid la byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du bye brag tu byed pas ni bde bar gshegs pa yid la byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if one makes distinctions, one does not have the Tathāgata in mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bye brag la lhag par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bye brag la lhag par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has abandoned attachment to the distinctions of the Bhagavat.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pas ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pas ni /
translated: And by conceptualizing the Tathāgata in terms of his own nature and the nature of others,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: one does not attain the authentic wisdom.

original: kha na ma tho ba'i rgyu chen po dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i rgyu chen po dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: And one becomes possessed of a great cause of demerit.

original: de'i phyir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyi dra ba'i le'u las /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyi dra ba'i le'u las /
translated: Therefore, in the Net of Magical Manifestation Tantra, in the chapter on the net of meditative concentrations,🔽it says:

original: bdag nyid lus 'di dri ma med pa las //
analyzed: bdag nyid lus 'di dri ma med pa las //
translated: This body of mine is stainless,

original: mtha' yas rgyal ba'i sku rnams yid kyis mngon bcug pas //
analyzed: mtha' yas rgyal ba'i sku rnams yid kyis mngon bcug pas //
translated: The infinite bodies of the Victorious Ones are made manifest by the mind.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mtshungs ba'i blo gros mchog /'gro ba ma lus pa la phan 'dogs bsgrub par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mtshungs ba'i blo gros mchog /'gro ba ma lus pa la phan 'dogs bsgrub par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The supreme intelligence that is equal to all the Buddhas will be achieved in order to benefit all beings without exception.

original: de bas na de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i tshogs dpag tu med pa spros pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i rten du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i tshogs dpag tu med pa spros pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i rten du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the infinite rays of light that are emanated become the basis for accomplishing the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: de la gang dag gis rang gi shes rab kyi btsan mo @185b dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi thabs gzhan du bsgrub pa mngon du byed pas ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de la gang dag gis rang gi shes rab kyi btsan mo @185b dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi thabs gzhan du bsgrub pa mngon du byed pas ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Those who are without the queen of their own wisdom will not attain the result of meditative concentration because they are engaged in the means for suffering.

original: shes rab de'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab de'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should cultivate the essence of that wisdom with an unmistaken mind.

original: dri ma dang bral zhing phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni yang dag pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral zhing phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni yang dag pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result, which is free from stain and is perfect, arises from the power of right means and right insight.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis phyin ci ma log pa las bdag med pa'i shes pa skyes pa na gcig gi mtshan nyid du gyur kyang tha snyad kyi dbye ba las lhag par zhen pas gnyis su med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis phyin ci ma log pa las bdag med pa'i shes pa skyes pa na gcig gi mtshan nyid du gyur kyang tha snyad kyi dbye ba las lhag par zhen pas gnyis su med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when the knowledge of selflessness arises from those two in a nonerroneous way, although it has the characteristic of one, it is nondual because of the attachment to a division of conventional expressions.

original: de ltar phyin ci log gi sems kyis phye bas ni /
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log gi sems kyis phye bas ni /
translated: Thus, it is divided by a mind that is erroneous.

original: shes rab kyi lhag par zhen cing log pa'i dbang gis rang gi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi lhag par zhen cing log pa'i dbang gis rang gi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa med pa ste /
translated: It is attached to the superiority of insight and is powerless to perform its own function by the power of error.

original: dper na gong bu dang dngos por brtags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gong bu dang dngos por brtags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the imputation of a mass and a thing.

original: de bas na blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis rang gi shes rab kyi btsun mo la legs par 'khyud cing bde pa chen po'i ro nyams su myong bas rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom par bya ba dang / thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa las sprul pa'i mchod pas rang gi lus yang nas yang du mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis rang gi shes rab kyi btsun mo la legs par 'khyud cing bde pa chen po'i ro nyams su myong bas rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom par bya ba dang / thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa las sprul pa'i mchod pas rang gi lus yang nas yang du mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should meditate continuously by embracing well the queen of one's wisdom and experiencing the taste of the great bliss, and by the emanation offering from the non-duality of method and wisdom, one should repeatedly offer one's body.

original: de bas na ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni ji srid sprul pa dang / rang gi ngo bo gnyis su dbyer med pa de srid du mngon du byas te /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni ji srid sprul pa dang / rang gi ngo bo gnyis su dbyer med pa de srid du mngon du byas te /
translated: Therefore, by the process as explained, the manifestation of the essence of method and wisdom is manifested as long as the emanation and one's essence are inseparable.

original: rang gi shes pa phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor gyi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor gyi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one sees the yoga method and wisdom, which arise from one's unmistaken consciousness, as having the same characteristic.

original: de la de nyi rgyun gyi ngo bo nyid la dbyer med pa dang / sngon dang / sngon gyi kun du rtog pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang rgyun du 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la de nyi rgyun gyi ngo bo nyid la dbyer med pa dang / sngon dang / sngon gyi kun du rtog pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang rgyun du 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, it is not different from the nature of the sun, and it is always connected to all conceptual thoughts that arise from previous conceptual thoughts.

original: de la sprul pa tsam las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du ni rnam par rtog pa med pa na /
analyzed: de la sprul pa tsam las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du ni rnam par rtog pa med pa na /
translated: In that regard, when there is no conceptual thought except for the mere emanation,

original: kha dog la sogs pas dbye bde'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pas dbye bde'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: the nature of the various appearances of color and so forth is seen.

original: bdag med ma'i shes pa dang ji ltar gcig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i shes pa dang ji ltar gcig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the same as the consciousness of Nairātmya?

original: de lta na ni gcig ces bya ba rnam pa thams cad du med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gcig ces bya ba rnam pa thams cad du med par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the so-called one would not exist at all,

original: lha gcig gi sku la rang gi ngo bo cha shas du mar snang ste /
analyzed: lha gcig gi sku la rang gi ngo bo cha shas du mar snang ste /
translated: because the body of the one deity appears with many parts of its own nature.

original: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan cha shas med pa ni dmigs pa'i yul du @186a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan cha shas med pa ni dmigs pa'i yul du @186a * //
translated: It is because of its various natures.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: The partless other does not become the object of perception.

original: de bas na ji ltar kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo la gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bo lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin no zhes par yid
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo la gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bo lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin no zhes par yid
translated: Therefore, just as the nature of the conventional is posited as one, in the same way, in dependence on the adherence to the nature of various forms and so on, all are considered to be of the nature of the self.

original: la byed pa ni thog ma nas bdag med pa la lhag par zhen pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: la byed pa ni thog ma nas bdag med pa la lhag par zhen pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: From the beginning, one is engaged in the adherence to the nonexistence of the self.

original: de ni dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mos par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mos par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained as the conviction in the sameness of all things.

original: de bas na 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Therefore, being free from the aspects of grasping and so on, all become the same.

original: yul la lhag par zhen pa la ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du ni dngos po tha snyad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul la lhag par zhen pa la ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du ni dngos po tha snyad med pa nyid do //
translated: Apart from the adherence to objects, there is no other thing that is conventionally nonexistent.

original: de dag kyang shes pa rang gi ngo bor cig car du snang bas na tha dad dbye bar mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang shes pa rang gi ngo bor cig car du snang bas na tha dad dbye bar mi nus pa ste /
translated: Moreover, since they appear simultaneously as the nature of consciousness, they cannot be differentiated.

original: gzhan du mtshan nyid gcig pa med pa ni sngon du bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gzhan du mtshan nyid gcig pa med pa ni sngon du bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Elsewhere, the absence of a single characteristic has already been established.

original: de bas na thams cad lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid do zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i shes pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid do zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i shes pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: Therefore, “everything is the nature of the divine maṇḍala” is the engagement of the wisdom that individually analyzes the nature of the relative just as it is.

original: des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: By that, one will be established in the path of omniscience.

original: de la gzhan dag na re lha nyid la rnam par rtog pa'o zhes smra ba ni kha na ma tho ba'i rgyun chen por 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re lha nyid la rnam par rtog pa'o zhes smra ba ni kha na ma tho ba'i rgyun chen por 'gyur te ;
translated: Regarding that, others say that the deity is conceptual. That is a great stream of negativity.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la bsams nas rgyun chad par lta ba ni nam du yang dag pa'i byang chub la nye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la bsams nas rgyun chad par lta ba ni nam du yang dag pa'i byang chub la nye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thinking of the state of the result, the view of annihilation will never approach true awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdo las /🔽dmigs bcas rnam par dag pa la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdo las / dmigs bcas rnam par dag pa la //
translated: Also, the Bhagavān said in the Samāsaṃghika Sūtra:🔽“The unsurpassed result

original: brten nas 'bras bu bla na med /
analyzed: brten nas 'bras bu bla na med /
translated: is based on the purity of the one with an object.”

original: mi dmigs mtha' bzhi rnam bral ba'i //
analyzed: mi dmigs mtha' bzhi rnam bral ba'i //
translated: The nature of the dharmakāya is

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal chos kyi sku //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal chos kyi sku // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the luminous clarity that is free from the four extremes of reference points.

original: de bas na rgyu rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa lha'i sku las 'dras bu rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa lha'i sku las 'dras bu rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, from the cause, the pure deity’s form that is endowed with reference points, the result, the pure dharmakāya, is attained.

original: de'ang rgyu'i gnas skabs tsam na yang lha'i sku'i de nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de'ang rgyu'i gnas skabs tsam na yang lha'i sku'i de nyid yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, at the time of the cause, it is the suchness of the deity’s form.

original: de'i ngo bo dang gnyis su dbyer med par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang gnyis su dbyer med par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It becomes inseparable from the essence of that.

original: de bas na sems yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las grub pa'i mchod pa'i tshogs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi lha la mchod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na sems yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las grub pa'i mchod pa'i tshogs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi lha la mchod par bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the assembly of offerings that are created from the precious wish-fulfilling jewel of the mind are offered to the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: tha mal gyi gnas skabs na yang gzhan du gzugs yid du 'ong ba @186b dag mthong ba na /
analyzed: tha mal gyi gnas skabs na yang gzhan du gzugs yid du 'ong ba @186b dag mthong ba na /
translated: Even in the ordinary state, when one sees other beautiful forms,

original: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi lha ru bsgoms pas longs spyod par bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi lha ru bsgoms pas longs spyod par bya zhing /
translated: one should enjoy them by meditating on oneself as the deity of the maṇḍala.

original: aom na ma sarba mandala de ba ta nam r'u pa p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis de'i skad cig la gzugs kyi mchod pa bla na med pa spros pas mchod par bya ba dang / gzhan du sgra yid du 'ong ba dag thos pa ni bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las sgra'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros pa las /
analyzed: aom na ma sarba mandala de ba ta nam r'u pa p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis de'i skad cig la gzugs kyi mchod pa bla na med pa spros pas mchod par bya ba dang / gzhan du sgra yid du 'ong ba dag thos pa ni bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las sgra'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros pa las /
translated: and imagine that one is making offerings with the unequaled offering of sound.🔽One should make offerings with the mantra:🔽oṃ namo manḍala deva tāna gandha pūja megha niḥryāya hūṃ

original: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam shabta p'u dza megha ni rya ta y'a me zhes pa'i sngags kyis dbul bar bya ba dang / gzhan du dri yid du 'ong ba bdag tshor ba na bdag nyid dang rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las dri'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros te /
analyzed: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam shabta p'u dza megha ni rya ta y'a me zhes pa'i sngags kyis dbul bar bya ba dang / gzhan du dri yid du 'ong ba bdag tshor ba na bdag nyid dang rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las dri'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros te /
translated: and imagine that one is making offerings with the unequaled offering of smell.

original: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam gandha p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pas mchod par bya ba dang / gzhan du ro yid du 'ong bdag nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las ro'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros pa las /
analyzed: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam gandha p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pas mchod par bya ba dang / gzhan du ro yid du 'ong bdag nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las ro'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros pa las /
translated: When one experiences a pleasant taste, one should imagine that one offers the unsurpassed offering of taste to the deities of the maṇḍala through one's yoga.

original: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba t'a nam ra sa p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um /🔽zhes pas mchod par bya ba nyid dang / gzhan du reg bya yid du 'ong ba bdag nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las /
analyzed: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba t'a nam ra sa p'u dza me gha ni rya ta y'a mi h'um / zhes pas mchod par bya ba nyid dang / gzhan du reg bya yid du 'ong ba bdag nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las /
translated: One should offer with Oṃ namo! To all maṇḍala deities, I offer the unsurpassed offering of taste.

original: reg bya'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros te /
analyzed: reg bya'i mchod pa bla na med pa spros te /
translated: When one experiences a pleasant touch, one should imagine that one offers the unsurpassed offering of touch to the deities of the maṇḍala through one's yoga.

original: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam par sha nirya ta y'a mi h'um /
analyzed: aom na ma ssarba mandala de ba ta nam par sha nirya ta y'a mi h'um /
translated: One should offer with Oṃ namo! To all maṇḍala deities, I offer the unsurpassed offering of touch.

original: zhes pas mchod par bya ba nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs ba gtong ba'i skabs su ni sbyin pa'i gnas dkyil 'khor gyi lha ru bsams la sbyin pa'i rdzas dpag tu med pa spros pas mchod par bya ba dang / bla ma las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byed pa na ni /🔽de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi lhar bsgoms pa la /
analyzed: zhes pas mchod par bya ba nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs ba gtong ba'i skabs su ni sbyin pa'i gnas dkyil 'khor gyi lha ru bsams la sbyin pa'i rdzas dpag tu med pa spros pas mchod par bya ba dang / bla ma las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byed pa na ni / de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi lhar bsgoms pa la /
translated: When one serves and respects sentient beings other than the guru,🔽one should meditate on them as the mandala deities and make offerings with the mantra, “namaḥ sarva mandala deva tvaṃ pūjopaṣṭhāna ātmanā niryātayāmi hūṃ.”

original: na ma sarba mandala de ba ta nam p'u dzo pa stha na a'atma na ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pas mchod pa bya ba dang bdag nyid la gzhan bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byed pa na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las gong ma'i sngags🔽kyis longs spyod par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: na ma sarba mandala de ba ta nam p'u dzo pa stha na a'atma na ni rya ta y'a mi h'um zhes pas mchod pa bya ba dang bdag nyid la gzhan bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byed pa na bdag nyid rnal 'byor dang ldan pa las gong ma'i sngags🔽kyis longs spyod par bya ba nyid do //
translated: When others serve and respect oneself, one should enjoy it with the mantra of the higher consecration.

original: gzhan du rnal 'byor phyi rol du gyur pa na ni gzugs la ni snang ba ma dang / gar mkhan ma dang / me tog ma dang / phreng ba ma'i lha mor bsams pas mchod par bya ba dang / sgra la ni glu mkhan mar bsams pa las mchod par bya ba dang /🔽dri la ni bdug pa ma dang @187a * //
analyzed: gzhan du rnal 'byor phyi rol du gyur pa na ni gzugs la ni snang ba ma dang / gar mkhan ma dang / me tog ma dang / phreng ba ma'i lha mor bsams pas mchod par bya ba dang / sgra la ni glu mkhan mar bsams pa las mchod par bya ba dang / dri la ni bdug pa ma dang @187a * //
translated: and by imagining sound as the goddess Gītā.🔽He should make offerings by imagining smell as the goddesses Dhūpā and Gandhā,

original: dri chab mar bsams pas mchod par bya ba dang / reg bya la ni sgeg mor bsams pa las mchod par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: dri chab mar bsams pas mchod par bya ba dang / reg bya la ni sgeg mor bsams pa las mchod par bya ba nyid do //
translated: and by imagining touch as the goddess Lāsya.

original: de dag ni chags pa'i yul du gyur pa rnam par dag pas mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni chags pa'i yul du gyur pa rnam par dag pas mchod pa ste /
translated: These are offerings purified by the objects of desire.

original: gzhan du de las bzlog pa'i mi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong ba na'ang /
analyzed: gzhan du de las bzlog pa'i mi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong ba na'ang /
translated: Otherwise, when he experiences the five undesirable qualities that are the opposite of those,

original: sems kyi bde ba'i rnam par bsgyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba'i rnam par bsgyur te /
translated: he should transform them into the form of mental bliss.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bde ba chen po'i mchod pas mchod pa bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bde ba chen po'i mchod pas mchod pa bya ba nyid do //
translated: He should make offerings by making offerings of great bliss through the yoga of the deity.

original: de ltar rgyun du skad cig ma gcig kyang rnal 'byor dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du skad cig ma gcig kyang rnal 'byor dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because one is never separated from yoga even for a moment,

original: rang gi shes rab kyi btsun mo la mnyam par 'khyud par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi shes rab kyi btsun mo la mnyam par 'khyud par bya ba nyid de /
translated: one should embrace the queen of one’s wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi bdag nyid las byung zhing thabs bla na med par gyur pa'i phyir thabs dang shes rab skad cig tsam yang mi 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bdag nyid las byung zhing thabs bla na med par gyur pa'i phyir thabs dang shes rab skad cig tsam yang mi 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Because it arises from the nature of wisdom and becomes unexcelled method, one should not be separated from method and wisdom even for a moment.

original: de ltar sems las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sems las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, everything is accomplished from the mind.

original: de yang dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Heap of Jewels Sūtra observes:

original: sems ni sa dang mtshungs pas na //
analyzed: sems ni sa dang mtshungs pas na //
translated: The mind is like the earth

original: thams cad khur du khyer bar byed //
analyzed: thams cad khur du khyer bar byed //
translated: because it bears all burdens.

original: dge ba dang ni sdig pa'ang rung //
analyzed: dge ba dang ni sdig pa'ang rung //
translated: Whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: 'phel ba med cing 'grib pa'ang med //
analyzed: 'phel ba med cing 'grib pa'ang med //
translated: it neither increases nor decreases.

original: sems ni chu dang mtshungs pas na //
analyzed: sems ni chu dang mtshungs pas na //
translated: The mind is like water🔽because it cleanses the stains of impurity,

original: dri ma mi gtsang 'khru byed dang // 'jig rten rnams ni gso byed cing //
analyzed: dri ma mi gtsang 'khru byed dang // 'jig rten rnams ni gso byed cing //
translated: it heals the world,

original: nyon mongs gdung ba sal par byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs gdung ba sal par byed //
translated: and it cools the torment of the afflictions.

original: sems ni me dang mtshungs pa na //
analyzed: sems ni me dang mtshungs pa na //
translated: The mind is like fire🔽because it burns the fuel of the afflictions,🔽it digests the food of the branches of enlightenment,🔽and it ripens the fruit of omniscience.

original: nyon mongs dag ni sreg byed cing //
analyzed: nyon mongs dag ni sreg byed cing //
translated: It burns away all afflictions.

original: sgron ma chen po snang ba yis //
analyzed: sgron ma chen po snang ba yis //
translated: The great lamp of illumination

original: gsal bar mi byed gang yang med //
analyzed: gsal bar mi byed gang yang med //
translated: illuminates everything.

original: sems ni rlung dang mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: sems ni rlung dang mtshungs pa ste //
translated: The mind is like the wind,

original: gnas pa med cing rten med par //
analyzed: gnas pa med cing rten med par //
translated: without abode or support.

original: tshul khrims thos pa'i dri yis ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims thos pa'i dri yis ni //
translated: The fragrance of ethical discipline and learning

original: dus gsum kun du khyab par byed //
analyzed: dus gsum kun du khyab par byed //
translated: pervades everywhere in the three times.

original: sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas //
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas //
translated: The mind is like space,🔽free of views and completely pure.

original: lta ba spangs shing rnam par dag / thams cad kun du khyab gnas kyang //
analyzed: lta ba spangs shing rnam par dag / thams cad kun du khyab gnas kyang //
translated: It pervades everywhere,

original: bdud kyi rjes su 'brang mi byed //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi rjes su 'brang mi byed // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but does not follow the demons.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan lnga zhes bya se /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan lnga zhes bya se /
translated: This is called the five virtues of the yogi's training.

original: rgya mtsho lta bu dang // ri rab lta bu dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / rlung lta bu dang / rdo rje lta bu'i chos lnga'o /
analyzed: rgya mtsho lta bu dang // ri rab lta bu dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / rlung lta bu dang / rdo rje lta bu'i chos lnga'o /
translated: They are the five dharmas of being like the ocean, like Mount Meru, like space, like the wind, and like a vajra.

original: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i lam la zhugs pa la ni 'khor ba'i 'dam na gnas kyang padma lta bu 'khor ba'i nyes pas gos bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i lam la zhugs pa la ni 'khor ba'i 'dam na gnas kyang padma lta bu 'khor ba'i nyes pas gos bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, one who has entered the path of complete purification, even though dwelling in the mire of cyclic existence, is like a lotus, not soiled by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: ston ka'i zla ba ltar @187b gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba ltar @187b gnas pa ste /
translated: One abides like the autumn moon.

original: de nyid yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i bslab pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / yang dag pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i bslab pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / yang dag pa'i bzod pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid do //
translated: That is itself arisen from the cause of right meditative stabilization, right training, right wisdom, right effort, and right patience.🔽Thus, in all the rites, one who is engaged in the rite of deity yoga performs the rite.🔽In the context of the rite of fire sacrifice, it is said that one should perform the rite of the yoga of the single seal.

original: de ltar bdag nyid las thams cad kyi skabs su lha'i rnal 'byor gyi las la yang dag par zhugs pas bya ba byed cing sbyin sreg gi skabs su phyag rgya gcig pa'i rnal 'byor gyi las bya bar gsungs pa ni gong du lha'i sku bskyed nas las bya🔽bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid las thams cad kyi skabs su lha'i rnal 'byor gyi las la yang dag par zhugs pas bya ba byed cing sbyin sreg gi skabs su phyag rgya gcig pa'i rnal 'byor gyi las bya bar gsungs pa ni gong du lha'i sku bskyed nas las bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Having generated the deity’s form, it is said that one should perform the rite.

original: de nas las rnams bshad bya sta //
analyzed: de nas las rnams bshad bya sta //
translated: Then the rites are explained.

original: zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa'i las //
analyzed: zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa'i las //
translated: The rites of pacifying and increasing

original: de ltar dbang dang mngon spyod rnams//
analyzed: de ltar dbang dang mngon spyod rnams//
translated: Thus, the empowerments and the violent actions

original: bzlas dang sbyin sreg cho ga yis //
analyzed: bzlas dang sbyin sreg cho ga yis //
translated: are to be performed by the ritual of recitation and burnt offerings.

original: las rnams thams cad bya ba yin //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad bya ba yin //
translated: All the actions are to be performed by these.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa las thams cad la bzlas pa'i sngags kyi yig 'bru'i kha dog dang / de'i las kyi sngags dang rnal 'byor dang / rgyan dang cha byad dang / rdzas dang yo byad dang / kha dog dang dus tshod la sogs pa /🔽rigs dang rjes su mthun pa las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa las thams cad la bzlas pa'i sngags kyi yig 'bru'i kha dog dang / de'i las kyi sngags dang rnal 'byor dang / rgyan dang cha byad dang / rdzas dang yo byad dang / kha dog dang dus tshod la sogs pa / rigs dang rjes su mthun pa las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: This is stated because all the actions such as pacification are accomplished by the color of the syllables of the mantra of recitation, the mantra of action, the yoga, the ornaments and attire, the substances and articles, the color, the time, and so forth, which are in accordance with the family.🔽Otherwise, the results of the actions will not be accomplished.

original: gzhan du ni las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing de dag kyang 'di nyid du bgegs nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing de dag kyang 'di nyid du bgegs nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Moreover, these are for the purpose of pacifying the obstacles in this very life.

original: de dag ji lta bus bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag ji lta bus bya snyam pa la /
translated: If one wonders how they are to be performed,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag bsgyur la //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bdag bsgyur la //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Having transformed oneself into Vajrasattva,

original: zhi ba'i las ni brtsam par bya //🔽cho ga shes pas snga dro nyid //
analyzed: zhi ba'i las ni brtsam par bya // cho ga shes pas snga dro nyid //
translated: one should undertake the action of pacification.🔽The one who knows the rite should recite

original: bzlas dang sbyin sreg nyid byed cing //
analyzed: bzlas dang sbyin sreg nyid byed cing //
translated: and perform the burnt offering in the morning.

original: 'od zer sprin gyis de'i lus la //
analyzed: 'od zer sprin gyis de'i lus la //
translated: The cloud of light rays

original: 'phros pas yongs su khebs pas dgab //
analyzed: 'phros pas yongs su khebs pas dgab //
translated: radiates and covers his body,

original: rtag tu shar bltas 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: rtag tu shar bltas 'od zer gyis //
translated: always looking at the rising sun,

original: nyes pa thams cad sel byed pa ;
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad sel byed pa ;
translated: the light rays remove all faults.

original: / de ni sems can phan dga' bas //
analyzed: / de ni sems can phan dga' bas //
translated: That is the joy of benefiting sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya //
translated: in the Tathagata family.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therein, in order to perfect one's own and others' goals,

original: bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed la /
translated: the yogi/nī generates oneself as glorious Vajrasattva according to the previously explained stages.

original: nyi ma dang po shar ba'i rtse la gos dang rgyan thams cad dang / rigs dang rjes su mthun pa byas la kha shar phyogs su bltas te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang po shar ba'i rtse la gos dang rgyan thams cad dang / rigs dang rjes su mthun pa byas la kha shar phyogs su bltas te /
translated: On the first day of the lunar month, wearing all the ornaments and clothes, and acting in accordance with one's family, facing east,

original: bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg bya ba nyid do //
translated: one should perform the recitation and burnt offerings.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pas sems can gang dag ngan song du gnas pa'i lus la h'um las 'phros pa'i @188a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pas sems can gang dag ngan song du gnas pa'i lus la h'um las 'phros pa'i @188a * //
translated: Similarly, through pure meditative stabilization, sentient beings who dwell in the lower realms are covered with light rays radiating from hūṃ.

original: 'od zer kha dog dkar po 'tsher ba dang ldan pa la de'i rtse mo la sdig pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i yig 'bru h'um dkar po bltas te /
analyzed: 'od zer kha dog dkar po 'tsher ba dang ldan pa la de'i rtse mo la sdig pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i yig 'bru h'um dkar po bltas te /
translated: One should visualize a white syllable hūṃ at the tip of the light rays, which are shining with white radiance, and which pacify all evil.

original: de'i lus la kun du khyab par byas nas rgya mtsho'i lbu ba la rlung gis bshig pa lta bus sdig pa zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i lus la kun du khyab par byas nas rgya mtsho'i lbu ba la rlung gis bshig pa lta bus sdig pa zhi bar bya ste /
translated: One should pacify evil by means of that, which pervades one’s body, like a bubble in the ocean destroyed by the wind.

original: de ni 'khor lo rigs kyi 'od zer yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya ba nyid do //🔽kun du bzang po bde chen nam //
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo rigs kyi 'od zer yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya ba nyid do // kun du bzang po bde chen nam //
translated: This is the light ray of the family of the wheel, and so it is the activity for the family of the Tathāgata.🔽One should visualize Samantabhadra, great bliss,

original: bde ba chen por bsams nas kyang //🔽nang par re re nyi shar na //
analyzed: bde ba chen por bsams nas kyang // nang par re re nyi shar na //
translated: or Mahāsukha,

original: snga ma bzhin du las byas te //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du las byas te //
translated: and perform the rite as before,🔽each morning at sunrise,

original: rdo rje rigs kyi sems can gyi //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi sems can gyi //
translated: and the evil mind of a being of the Vajra family,

original: sdig can sems ni zhi byed 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig can sems ni zhi byed 'gyur //
translated: which is sinful, will be pacified.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni /🔽bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas kyang /🔽bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po'am /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni / bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas kyang / bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po'am /
translated: This is what is said.🔽One should generate oneself as the Blessed One Samantabhadra,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bskyed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bskyed de /
translated: or the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, by the procedure taught above.

original: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnal 'byor rim pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnal 'byor rim pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: One should perform the complete stages of yoga in accordance with the family.

original: rang gi snying gnas 'od zer mu tig lta bu'i phreng ba'i tshogs la sdig pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i ye ge h'um bltas te /
analyzed: rang gi snying gnas 'od zer mu tig lta bu'i phreng ba'i tshogs la sdig pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i ye ge h'um bltas te /
translated: From one's heart one should visualize a garland of pearl-like light rays, and the syllable hūṃ that pacifies all evil.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi sems can gyi lus la yongs su khebs par dgab pa dang / sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las thams cad bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi sems can gyi lus la yongs su khebs par dgab pa dang / sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las thams cad bya ba nyid do //
translated: One should cover the bodies of sentient beings of the Vajra family, and perform all activities such as burnt offerings.🔽One should visualize the sun,

original: gser 'od mdzes shing 'bar ba yi //
analyzed: gser 'od mdzes shing 'bar ba yi //
translated: beautiful and blazing golden light,

original: rin chen 'dzin du bsams nas ni //🔽bza' ba longs spyod nyi ma yi //
analyzed: rin chen 'dzin du bsams nas ni // bza' ba longs spyod nyi ma yi //
translated: as the bearer of jewels,🔽and the auspicious activity of expansion

original: gung la rgyas pa'i las shis te //
analyzed: gung la rgyas pa'i las shis te //
translated: at noon, enjoying food.

original: rin chen 'dra bar khung brkos la //
analyzed: rin chen 'dra bar khung brkos la //
translated: One should dig a pit like a jewel,

original: bzlas dang sbyin sreg bya ba'am //
analyzed: bzlas dang sbyin sreg bya ba'am //
translated: and perform recitation and burnt offerings,

original: yang na sngags pa snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: yang na sngags pa snga ma bzhin //
translated: or else, as before, the mantra practitioner

original: 'od kyis lus la rab tu dag pa //
analyzed: 'od kyis lus la rab tu dag pa //
translated: purifies the body with light.

original: ces gsungs pa ni rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa ni rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: This is the yoga of expansion.

original: de la dang po bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan du sku mdog ser po bsams te /
analyzed: de la dang po bdag nyid gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan du sku mdog ser po bsams te /
translated: Blessed One Ratnasaṃbhava, yellow in color.

original: nyi ma gung la kha byang du bltas pas sbyin sreg la sogs pa bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyi ma gung la kha byang du bltas pas sbyin sreg la sogs pa bya ba'am /
translated: At noon, facing north, one should perform the homa, and so forth.🔽Or, one should visualize oneself as having a very bright light-like ray

original: bdag nyid kyi snying ga nas 'od zer gyi kha dog lta bu shin tu 'tsher ba dang ldan pa bsams pa las /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi snying ga nas 'od zer gyi kha dog lta bu shin tu 'tsher ba dang ldan pa bsams pa las /
translated: emanating from one’s heart.🔽At its tip, one should visualize the syllable trāṃ or a yellow one, which

original: de'i rtse mo la tshe dang bsod nams thams cad rgyas par byed pa'i yig 'bru tr'am ser po bltas te /
analyzed: de'i rtse mo la tshe dang bsod nams thams cad rgyas par byed pa'i yig 'bru tr'am ser po bltas te /
translated: causes all longevity and merit to increase.

original: rin chen rigs kyi sems can la dgab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rin chen rigs kyi sems can la dgab par bya ba ste /
translated: One should cover the beings of the Ratnasaṃbhava family with it.

original: des ni tshe dang bsod nams thams cad zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du 'phel bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: des ni tshe dang bsod nams thams cad zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du 'phel bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thereby, all longevity and merit will increase like the waxing moon.

original: cho ga bzhin du khung bu ni @188b padma 'dra bar byas nas kyang //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du khung bu ni @188b padma 'dra bar byas nas kyang //
translated: One should make a hole in the ground in the shape of a lotus, in accordance with the rite.

original: padma 'dzin par bdag bsgyur la //
analyzed: padma 'dzin par bdag bsgyur la //
translated: One should transform oneself into Padma Holder.

original: rgas dang nya ba'i nyi ma'i mthar //
analyzed: rgas dang nya ba'i nyi ma'i mthar //
translated: At the end of the day, when the sun is setting,

original: bzlas dang sbyin sreg bya ba'am //
analyzed: bzlas dang sbyin sreg bya ba'am //

analyzed: rtse gsum pa lta bu'i 'od zer rtse mo rno ba zur dang ldan pa spro bar bya ste /
translated: or like a trident, with sharp points and facets.

original: des ni gang dang gang la de dang de'i kun du khyab par bskor ba ni zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod kyi las thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des ni gang dang gang la de dang de'i kun du khyab par bskor ba ni zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod kyi las thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: By that, whatever is pervaded by that, whatever is surrounded by that, all the activities of pacifying, enriching, controlling, and destroying are accomplished just as they are performed.

original: de las dbang du byas na rjes su chags pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pa bzhin ston pa dang / zhi bar byas na ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / rgyas pa byas na ni 'byor pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de las dbang du byas na rjes su chags pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pa bzhin ston pa dang / zhi bar byas na ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / rgyas pa byas na ni 'byor pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: In that, with regard to controlling, one should teach like a devoted lover, and if one performs pacifying, one will attain the happiness of being free from suffering, and if one performs enriching, one will become wealthy.

original: drag po'i las byas na ni de ma thag tu nad dang zug rngu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ba de las 'byung ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: drag po'i las byas na ni de ma thag tu nad dang zug rngu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ba de las 'byung ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: If one performs wrathful activity, one will immediately be afflicted with illness and pain, and one will be burned by a blazing fire. That is the result of that.

original: de ltar cho ga dang rnal 'byor thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de ltar cho ga dang rnal 'byor thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba las /
translated: Thus, from the perfection of all the rites and yogas,

original: @190b phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pas na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' yongs su brtags pa'i las thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: @190b phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pas na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' yongs su brtags pa'i las thams cad bya ste /
translated: Since all the activities of the four types of activity will be accomplished, all the activities of the Tathāgata’s word should be performed by yogins and yoginīs.

original: gzhan du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur pas ni mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur pas ni mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since they will not be accomplished otherwise, they should not be performed.

original: de nas tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad yid mgu rangs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad yid mgu rangs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa /
translated: Then all Brahmā, Śakra, and so on, being pleased and delighted, bowed to the Bhagavān and said this:🔽“Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara, for the benefit of all sentient beings, you have explained this king of tantras, the excellent purification of all evil destinies, which cuts through all doubts,

original: don thams cad rgyas par ston pa'i ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i brtag pa'i rgyal po dam pa phyi ma 'di bshad pa legs so //
analyzed: don thams cad rgyas par ston pa'i ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i brtag pa'i rgyal po dam pa phyi ma 'di bshad pa legs so //
translated: and reveals all meanings extensively.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po legs so legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po legs so legs so //
translated: Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara, excellent, excellent!”

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi mtshon par gyur pa'i phyag rgya rnams bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dam pa'i chos kyis yang dag par mgu bar gyur pa'i tshig snyan pa lan bzhir brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi mtshon par gyur pa'i phyag rgya rnams bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dam pa'i chos kyis yang dag par mgu bar gyur pa'i tshig snyan pa lan bzhir brjod pa ste /
translated: The request to explain the mudras that symbolize them is the four times the pleasant speech of the gods such as Brahma, who are satisfied with the sublime Dharma.

original: de la sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal pos sems can rnams ngan song rnam pa gsum gyi 'dam nas yang dag par 'don pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal pos sems can rnams ngan song rnam pa gsum gyi 'dam nas yang dag par 'don pa ste /
translated: Therein, “in order to benefit all sentient beings” is the tathagata who completely extracts sentient beings from the swamp of the three lower realms.

original: de nyid rgyud rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor las byung zhing /
analyzed: de nyid rgyud rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor las byung zhing /
translated: That is the yoga of the two kinds of tantras.

original: rgyud rnam pa gnyis ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dbang dang / sbyin sreg dang cho ga la sogs pa'i las su bya ba'i rim pa rnams rgyud rnam pa gnyis por gsal bar ma gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de nyid gsal bar byed pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud 'di bshad pas sems can rnams la phan par
analyzed: rgyud rnam pa gnyis ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dbang dang / sbyin sreg dang cho ga la sogs pa'i las su bya ba'i rim pa rnams rgyud rnam pa gnyis por gsal bar ma gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de nyid gsal bar byed pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud 'di bshad pas sems can rnams la phan par
translated: The rite of initiation, which is a branch of the two kinds of tantras, and the stages of rites to be performed such as fire sacrifice and ritual, which are not clear in the two kinds of tantras, are explained in this explanatory tantra, which elucidates just that Bhagavat Vajrapani, for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'gyur bar 'grel to //
analyzed: 'gyur bar 'grel to //
translated: It is explained.

original: the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa ni dbang la sogs pa ji lta ba mi shes pa gsal bar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad rnam par gcod pa ni dbang la sogs pa ji lta ba mi shes pa gsal bar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The elimination of all doubts is just the elucidation of the unknown, such as initiation, etc.

original: de nyid rgyud gnyis kyi don thams cad rgyas par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na don thams cad rgyas par ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyud gnyis kyi don thams cad rgyas par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na don thams cad rgyas par ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is the extensive teaching of the meaning of all of the two tantras, it is called the extensive teaching of all meanings.

original: brtag pa'i rgyal po don rgyas par ston pa nyid la yon tan gyi sgo nas mtshan btags pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i rgyal po don rgyas par ston pa nyid la yon tan gyi sgo nas mtshan btags pa'o //
translated: The king of investigations is designated by name from the point of view of its quality of being the extensive teaching of meaning.

original: phyi mar ni slad mar @191a * //
analyzed: phyi mar ni slad mar @191a * //
translated: In the latter, later means

original: gyur pa'o // snyan pa'i tshig ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: gyur pa'o // snyan pa'i tshig ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The sweet words have been explained above.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi mtshon pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi mtshon pa zhes pa ni /
translated: For what reason?

original: sems can thams cad kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings is the indication.

original: de dag gi mtshon pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya dang / 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha mtshon pa ste de nyid phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshon pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya dang / 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha mtshon pa ste de nyid phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
translated: The indication is the previously mentioned mudrā of the Bhagavat's own maṇḍala and the indication of the worldly maṇḍala deities, which is explained to be the mudrā itself.

original: de dag sngar ma bshad pa'i phyir bshad par gsol ba 'debs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag sngar ma bshad pa'i phyir bshad par gsol ba 'debs pa nyid do //
translated: Since they have not been explained previously, [the Bhagavat] requests the explanation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes phyag rgya'i le'u 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes phyag rgya'i le'u 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi explained this chapter on mudrās.

original: lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag la /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag la /
translated: Place the two hands in front,

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: and bless them as a moon maṇḍala from the letter A.

original: de'i steng du h'um dang aa las rigs kyi bdag po rigs ltar bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um dang aa las rigs kyi bdag po rigs ltar bsams nas /
translated: On that, imagine the lord of the family as the family, from the letter HŪṃ and A.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid las aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug gis kun nas 'khor zhing 'od zer sna tshogs 'phro ba bsgoms te ;🔽mthe bong gnyis la aom zhes bya ba bsam /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid las aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug gis kun nas 'khor zhing 'od zer sna tshogs 'phro ba bsgoms te ; mthe bong gnyis la aom zhes bya ba bsam /
translated: From the very center of the moon maṇḍala, meditate on the sixteen vowels such as a and so on, radiating various light rays.🔽Think of oṃ on the two thumbs,

original: mdzub mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba bsam /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba bsam /
translated: think of hūṃ on the two index fingers,

original: gung mo gnyis la tr'am zhes bya ba bsam /🔽srin lag gnyis la hri zhes bya ba bsam /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis la tr'am zhes bya ba bsam / srin lag gnyis la hri zhes bya ba bsam /
translated: think of traṃ on the two middle fingers,🔽think of hrīḥ on the two ring fingers,

original: mthe'u chung gnyis la aa zhes bya ba bsam /
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis la aa zhes bya ba bsam /
translated: and think of āḥ on the two pinky fingers.

original: de ltar yi ge rnams bzhag nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin par mos pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge rnams bzhag nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin par mos pa bskyed de /
translated: After placing the syllables in that way, one should generate the conviction that they are the tathāgatas.

original: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres par gyur pa dang / bdag dang rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres par gyur pa dang / bdag dang rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: “All phenomena merge into one another and should be made to accord with oneself” means

original: 'dir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya thams cad kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya thams cad kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: that here the characteristics of all mundane and supramundane mudras are taught.

original: da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin la /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin la /
translated: Now, this is the samaya mudra.

original: phyag rgya'i le'u zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor phyi ma rnams kyi phyag rgya'i le'u ste de yang dag par bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i le'u zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor phyi ma rnams kyi phyag rgya'i le'u ste de yang dag par bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The chapter on seals is the chapter on the seals of the outer mandalas, and it is explained correctly.

original: de la lag pa gnyis mdun du gzhag pa ni phyag rgya bcings ba'i las kyi dus su bab par gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du blo bskyed pa las rang gi mdun du dus mo'i khar lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo gan rgyal du gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la lag pa gnyis mdun du gzhag pa ni phyag rgya bcings ba'i las kyi dus su bab par gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du blo bskyed pa las rang gi mdun du dus mo'i khar lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo gan rgyal du gzhag ste /
translated: In that regard, placing the two hands in front is when the time of the activity of binding the seals has arrived, and for the sake of all sentient beings, generating the mind, one places the two palms of the hands face up in front of oneself.

original: de gnyis kyi mthil du aa dkar po 'od dang ldan pa gnyis bsams la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mthil du aa dkar po 'od dang ldan pa gnyis bsams la /
translated: In the two palms, one imagines two white A letters with light.

original: de gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsam mo //
analyzed: de gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bsam mo //
translated: From their transformation, one imagines two moon maṇḍalas.

original: yang de'i steng du h'um dang aa gnyis bsams pa las @191b lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje rtse lnga par gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: yang de'i steng du h'um dang aa gnyis bsams pa las @191b lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje rtse lnga par gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Again, on top of that, one imagines two HŪṃ and A letters, from which one imagines the right hand becomes a five-pronged vajra.

original: g-yon pa ni dril bu rtse lnga par gyur par bsams te der thim pas rdo rje'i lag pa dang / rdo rje dril bu'i lag par byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: g-yon pa ni dril bu rtse lnga par gyur par bsams te der thim pas rdo rje'i lag pa dang / rdo rje dril bu'i lag par byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Having imagined that they dissolve into those, one should bless the vajra hand and the vajra-bell hand.

original: der zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams pa ni de dag thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rol pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: der zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams pa ni de dag thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rol pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two moon-disks imagined there are the gesture of the non-dual play of method and wisdom.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi steng na'ang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug gis kun nas 'khor bar 'gyur pa las 'od zer chen po dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi steng na'ang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug gis kun nas 'khor bar 'gyur pa las 'od zer chen po dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, on top of the two moon-disks, one should meditate on the sixteen vowels such as A, arranged in order, and endowed with great light-rays.

original: de nas lag pa'i sor mo bcu rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu rtse lnga pa re re bsams pa'i rtse mo la yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bsams la /
analyzed: de nas lag pa'i sor mo bcu rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu rtse lnga pa re re bsams pa'i rtse mo la yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bsams la /
translated: Then, on the tips of the ten fingers of the two hands, one should imagine a vajra and a five-pointed vajra-bell.

original: de dag gi steng du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthe bong la bcom ldan 'das rnams par snang mdzad dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bo aom dkar po 'od dang ldan pa bsams par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du mdzub mo la bcom ldan 'das ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba dang / m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo h'um dkar po bsam par bya ba dang / gung mo la bcom ldan 'das rin chen tog dang / sangs rgyas spyan gyi ngo bor tr'am ser po bsam par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gi steng du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthe bong la bcom ldan 'das rnams par snang mdzad dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bo aom dkar po 'od dang ldan pa bsams par bya'o // de bzhin du mdzub mo la bcom ldan 'das ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba dang / m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo h'um dkar po bsam par bya ba dang / gung mo la bcom ldan 'das rin chen tog dang / sangs rgyas spyan gyi ngo bor tr'am ser po bsam par bya ba dang /
translated: On top of those, one should imagine, in order, on the thumbs, the Blessed One Vairocana and the essence of Vajradhātvīśvarī, a white OṂ with light;🔽similarly, on the index fingers, the Blessed One Sarvaśodhana and the essence of Māmakī, a white HŪṂ; on the middle fingers, the Blessed One Ratnaketu and the essence of Buddhalocanā, a yellow TRAṂ;

original: srin lag la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang gos dkar mo'i ngo bo hri dmar po bsam par bya ba dang / mthe'u chung gnyis la bcom ldan 'das me tog chen po rgyas pa dang / sgrol ma'i ngo bo aa ljang gu bsams te /
analyzed: srin lag la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang gos dkar mo'i ngo bo hri dmar po bsam par bya ba dang / mthe'u chung gnyis la bcom ldan 'das me tog chen po rgyas pa dang / sgrol ma'i ngo bo aa ljang gu bsams te /
translated: on the ring fingers, the Blessed One Śākyamuni and the essence of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, a red HṚĪḤ; and on the two little fingers, the Blessed One Mahākusuma and the essence of Tārā, a green A.

original: de nas rdo rje bsdams pa las thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya rnams skye zhing lha de dag ngo bo nyid gcig par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bsdams pa las thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya rnams skye zhing lha de dag ngo bo nyid gcig par mos par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the vajra-binding, the mudras of the mundane and supramundane are born from the union of method and wisdom, and one should imagine that all those deities are of the same nature.

original: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres pa ni 'di ltar snang ba'i chos spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid lha dang lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du thams cad bsams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres pa ni 'di ltar snang ba'i chos spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid lha dang lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du thams cad bsams te /
translated: All phenomena are mixed with one another in the following way: all general and specific characteristics of phenomena that appear are imagined as all being of the nature of male and female deities, the nature of great bliss, the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid bdag dang rjes su mthun pa ni chos kyi dbyings dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag dang rjes su mthun pa ni chos kyi dbyings dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: That itself is concordant with oneself, concordant with the dharmadhātu.

original: de la 'dir chos kyi dbyings bdag med pa la bdag ces ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de la 'dir chos kyi dbyings bdag med pa la bdag ces ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: In that regard, one may wonder, “How can the dharmadhātu, which is without self, be called ‘self’?”

original: de ni 'di ltar @192a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar @192a * //
translated: It is like this.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la bdag ces bya'o //
translated: The realm of phenomena is called “self” because all phenomena are of one taste in the nature of nondual great bliss.

original: de la chos thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / de las byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du shes par byed pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad de'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / de las byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du shes par byed pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
translated: There, it is called “self” because all phenomena are of its nature, arise from it, and are made known as being of its nature.

original: yang na de nyid rnal 'byor pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun zhing dbyer med pa'i phyir na bdag dang yang mthun par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de nyid rnal 'byor pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun zhing dbyer med pa'i phyir na bdag dang yang mthun par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is called “self” because it is in harmony with the yogi/nī and is inseparable from him/her.

original: de ni rig pa'i tshogs kyis bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang rjes su mthun pa las de'i bdag nyid la de'i bdag nyid kyis mchod pa byed par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rig pa'i tshogs kyis bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang rjes su mthun pa las de'i bdag nyid la de'i bdag nyid kyis mchod pa byed par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: That is to say, the collection of awarenesses is in harmony with the unsurpassed worship, and so the worship of that nature by that nature comes about.

original: mchod pa dang mchod par byed pa dang mchod par bya ba ni gzhan du med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang mchod par byed pa dang mchod par bya ba ni gzhan du med pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no worship, worshipper, or object of worship that is other than that.

original: de la 'dir gzugs kyi mchod pa bla na med pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de la 'dir gzugs kyi mchod pa bla na med pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: Here, the unsurpassed worship is the worship of form.

original: de'i mchod pa'i las byed pa dang / de dag nyid las 'da' bar dka' zhing lha'i tshogs 'byin pa'i phyir na dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i mchod pa'i las byed pa dang / de dag nyid las 'da' bar dka' zhing lha'i tshogs 'byin pa'i phyir na dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Since they perform the action of worship, and since it is difficult to transgress them, and since they emit the hosts of deities, they are called “pledge seals” alone.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje dang dril bur ldan pa'i sku ru bsams pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje dang dril bur ldan pa'i sku ru bsams pa nyid yin la /
translated: The great seal is the very contemplation of the body endowed with the vajra and bell.

original: las kyi phyag rgyan ni ting nge 'dzin dang sa gnon la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgyan ni ting nge 'dzin dang sa gnon la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The action seal is the seal of contemplation, earth-touching, and so forth.

original: tshes kyi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi ljags la badzra dzny'a na la sogs pas bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshes kyi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi ljags la badzra dzny'a na la sogs pas bsams pa'o //
translated: The doctrine seal is the contemplation of vajra-jñāna, etc., on the tongues of the deities.

original: de dag nyid ji lta bur bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag nyid ji lta bur bya snyam pa la /
translated: How should one perform those very seals?

original: lag pa gnyis padma lta bur sbyar nas /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis padma lta bur sbyar nas /
translated: Having joined the two hands like a lotus,

original: aom zhes bya ba gnyis brkyang nas a'a:zhes bya ba gnyis bkug la de bzhin du h'um zhes bya ba dang tri zhes bya ba gnyis padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas la /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba gnyis brkyang nas a'a:zhes bya ba gnyis bkug la de bzhin du h'um zhes bya ba dang tri zhes bya ba gnyis padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas la /
translated: one should extend the two Oṃs, bend the two Āḥs, and likewise make the two Hūṃs and the two Tros like lotus petals.

original: tram zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig go zhes gsungs pa ste /🔽de la 'dir dang por lag pa gnyis padma kha 'bus pa ltar byas la /🔽de nas gung mo gnyis gshibs te lto sbyar la brkyang nas srin lag dang mdzub mo gnyis so sor rtse sprad de /
analyzed: tram zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig go zhes gsungs pa ste / de la 'dir dang por lag pa gnyis padma kha 'bus pa ltar byas la / de nas gung mo gnyis gshibs te lto sbyar la brkyang nas srin lag dang mdzub mo gnyis so sor rtse sprad de /
translated: The two thumbs are extended side by side, and the two middle fingers are extended side by side, joined at the stomach.🔽The two ring fingers and two index fingers are joined at the tips.🔽The two joints of the middle fingers are bent, and the two thumbs are extended.

original: tshigs gnyis bkug la mthe bong brkyang pa byas nas mthe'u chung bkug pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs gnyis bkug la mthe bong brkyang pa byas nas mthe'u chung bkug pa'o //
translated: The two little fingers are bent.

original: gzhan du ni mthe'u chung brkyang bar gsungs te gang yang mi 'gal ba gnyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mthe'u chung brkyang bar gsungs te gang yang mi 'gal ba gnyid do //
translated: In another source, it is said that the two little fingers are extended, but there is no contradiction between the two.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las @192b thams cad dang ldan par bya ba'i dam tshig go zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi skabs su rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya zhes gsungs pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las @192b thams cad dang ldan par bya ba'i dam tshig go zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi skabs su rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya zhes gsungs pa de nyid yin te /
translated: This is the very seal of the vajra-holder that was mentioned above in the context of all mandalas.

original: de nyid dang por 'jug pa'i phyir na rtsa ba zhes bya ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / de nyid rnal 'byor pa dam tshig rnam par bcu dang lnga 'dzin pa'i phyir na las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang por 'jug pa'i phyir na rtsa ba zhes bya ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / de nyid rnal 'byor pa dam tshig rnam par bcu dang lnga 'dzin pa'i phyir na las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
translated: It is called “root” because it is the first entry, “all-pervasiveness” because it enters into all mandala rites, and “commitment seal of all activities” because it is the commitment of the yogi/nī to hold the five or ten commitments.

original: 'di dag phyag rgya'i tshogs yin te //
analyzed: 'di dag phyag rgya'i tshogs yin te //
translated: These are the collection of seals.🔽Then, made sharp,

original: de nas rnon por byas pa dang // de nyid rab tu 'khor lo 'dra //
analyzed: de nas rnon por byas pa dang // de nyid rab tu 'khor lo 'dra //
translated: it is like a wheel.

original: de nyid khar gzhag sgra gcan gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid khar gzhag sgra gcan gyi'o //
translated: Placing it in the mouth is Rāhu’s.

original: de nyid gsum byas las kyi'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsum byas las kyi'o // zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The third is the mudra of Karma.

original: 'dir lha dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa bzhi'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir lha dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa bzhi'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: The mudras of the four gods, Mahesvara and so on, are taught here.

original: de la dang po gung mo lto sbyar la brkyang ste /
analyzed: de la dang po gung mo lto sbyar la brkyang ste /
translated: The first is to join the palms together and extend them.

original: mdzub mo gnyis so sor brkyang la rtse mo gsum rnon por byas pa ste 'di ni drag po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis so sor brkyang la rtse mo gsum rnon por byas pa ste 'di ni drag po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two index fingers are extended separately and the tips are sharpened into three points. This is the mudra of Rudra.

original: gnyis pa ni bram ze'i rig byed kyi tshig smra ba ltar srin lag gi rtsa bar mthe bong bzhag ste lhag ma rnam brkyang bar bya ste de ni tshangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽gsum pa ni lag pa gnyis phan tshun du bsnol ba las gung mo gnyis rtse sprad la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo 'dra ba byas pa ste de ni khyab 'jug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bram ze'i rig byed kyi tshig smra ba ltar srin lag gi rtsa bar mthe bong bzhag ste lhag ma rnam brkyang bar bya ste de ni tshangs pa'i phyag rgya'o // gsum pa ni lag pa gnyis phan tshun du bsnol ba las gung mo gnyis rtse sprad la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo 'dra ba byas pa ste de ni khyab 'jug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The second is to place the thumbs at the base of the ring fingers as if reciting the words of the Brahmin Vedas, and extend the rest. This is the mudra of Brahma.🔽The third is to cross the two hands and join the tips of the middle fingers, making it resemble a weapon wheel. This is the mudra of Vishnu.

original: bzhi pa ni gung mo gnyis rtse sprad de bsgreng la mdzub mo dgu bor byas shing rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gung mo gnyis rtse sprad de bsgreng la mdzub mo dgu bor byas shing rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ste /
translated: The fourth is to join the tips of the middle fingers and extend them, with the index fingers bent and made to resemble a vajra.

original: de ni brgya byin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ni brgya byin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Śakra.

original: de dag ni gzhan du grags pa'i phyag rgya chen po bzhi zhes bya bas na phyag rgya'i tshogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan du grags pa'i phyag rgya chen po bzhi zhes bya bas na phyag rgya'i tshogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are called the four great mudrās that are well known elsewhere. Therefore, it is said that they are the collection of mudrās.🔽The left hand is like holding a skull,

original: g-yon pa mgo thod thogs 'dra dang // g-yas pa mdung rtse rtse gsum pa //
analyzed: g-yon pa mgo thod thogs 'dra dang // g-yas pa mdung rtse rtse gsum pa //
translated: and the right hand is a spear with a three-pointed tip.🔽The left hand is a lotus with a closed mouth,

original: g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum dang // g-yas pa aom zhes bya bar gzhag / g-yon pa 'khor lo dbyug thog gsum //
analyzed: g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum dang // g-yas pa aom zhes bya bar gzhag / g-yon pa 'khor lo dbyug thog gsum //
translated: and the right hand is placed with the syllable oṃ.🔽The left hand is a wheel and a club,

original: aa dang aom gnyis rtse sprad nas //
analyzed: aa dang aom gnyis rtse sprad nas //
translated: the two syllables a and oṃ are joined at the tips,

original: lhag ma gsum ni rdo rje can //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni rdo rje can //
translated: and the remaining three are vajras.

original: h'um dang aom gnyis gzhur byas la //
analyzed: h'um dang aom gnyis gzhur byas la //
translated: The two syllables hūṃ and oṃ are made into a bow,

original: lhag ma mda' byas mda' can gyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma mda' byas mda' can gyi'o //
translated: and the remaining three are arrows.🔽This is the mudrā of the wielder of arrows.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni 'jigs byed chen po dgu'i phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni 'jigs byed chen po dgu'i phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the mudrā of the nine great Bhairavas.

original: de la lag pa g-yon pa thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa @193a * //
analyzed: de la lag pa g-yon pa thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa @193a * //
translated: In that regard, the left hand is like holding a skull filled with blood,

original: dang 'dra bar sor mo rnams dgu bor byas la snying gar bzung ste /
analyzed: dang 'dra bar sor mo rnams dgu bor byas la snying gar bzung ste /
translated: and the fingers are spread out and held at the heart.

original: g-yas pa mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis rtse sprad de lhag ma gsum mtshon rtse gsum pa ltar byas te 'di ni 'jigs byed chen po dang / 'jigs byed thod pa can gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis rtse sprad de lhag ma gsum mtshon rtse gsum pa ltar byas te 'di ni 'jigs byed chen po dang / 'jigs byed thod pa can gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The right hand is the same as the left, except that the thumb and little finger are joined together, and the remaining three fingers are like the three points of a trident. This is the mudrā of Mahābhairava and Bhairava Kapālin.

original: gnyis pa ni lag pa g-yon pa padma kha 'bus pa ltar rtse mo bsdus la nu ma'i khar bzung la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lag pa g-yon pa padma kha 'bus pa ltar rtse mo bsdus la nu ma'i khar bzung la /
translated: The second is the left hand folded in like a budding lotus and held to the breast,

original: g-yas pa tshangs pa'i phyag rgya ltar byas pa ni 'jigs byed gtum po dang / 'jigs byed lag pa brgyad pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa tshangs pa'i phyag rgya ltar byas pa ni 'jigs byed gtum po dang / 'jigs byed lag pa brgyad pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: while the right hand is in the mudrā of Brahmā. This is the mudrā of Caṇḍa Bhairava and Aṣṭamūla Bhairava.

original: gsum pa ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo lta bur byas la /
