analyzed: gsum pa ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo lta bur byas la /
translated: The third is the left hand with the thumb and index finger joined together, like the spokes of a weapon wheel,

original: lhag ma gsum dbyug to lta bur byas pa ni 'jigs byed srog 'phrog dang / 'jigs byed smyo byed kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum dbyug to lta bur byas pa ni 'jigs byed srog 'phrog dang / 'jigs byed smyo byed kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: while the remaining three fingers are like a club. This is the mudrā of Jīvadhara Bhairava and Unmattabhairava.

original: bzhi pa ni rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya ltar byas pa yid dbu bor byas te de ni 'jigs byed khro bo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya ltar byas pa yid dbu bor byas te de ni 'jigs byed khro bo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The fourth is made like the mudra of the trident. The head of the mind is cast off. That is the mudra of Bhairava the wrathful one.

original: lnga pa ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis gzhu lta bur byas la g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams mda' lta bur brkyang ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis gzhu lta bur byas la g-yas pa'i sor mo rnams mda' lta bur brkyang ste /
translated: The fifth is made with the index finger and thumb of the left hand like a bow, and the fingers of the right hand extended like arrows.

original: de ni 'jigs byed lag brkyang gi phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //🔽lag pa g-yas g-yon 'khor lo bya //
analyzed: de ni 'jigs byed lag brkyang gi phyag rgyar shes par bya'o // lag pa g-yas g-yon 'khor lo bya //
translated: That should be known as the mudra of Bhairava the outstretched one.🔽The right and left hands are made into wheels.

original: thal mo dam sbyar sor mo 'phro //
analyzed: thal mo dam sbyar sor mo 'phro //
translated: The fingers are spread out from the tightly closed palms.

original: 'di ni nyi ma zla ba'i zhal //
analyzed: 'di ni nyi ma zla ba'i zhal //
translated: This is the face of the sun and moon.

original: gza' lhag rtag tu se gol gtogs //
analyzed: gza' lhag rtag tu se gol gtogs //
translated: The planet Rāhu always snaps the fingers.

original: de nyid tshig dbyung gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid tshig dbyung gsum pa ste /
translated: That itself is the third utterance.🔽The lips are placed like the shape of the utterance.

original: mchu la tshig dbyung 'dra bar gzhag / pa bsangs ni gnyis mnyam sbyar //
analyzed: mchu la tshig dbyung 'dra bar gzhag / pa bsangs ni gnyis mnyam sbyar //
translated: The nose is the equal union of the two.

original: sben pa dbyug pa 'dzin par bya //
analyzed: sben pa dbyug pa 'dzin par bya //
translated: The beard is held like a club.

original: ba lang sna ni chu srin 'dra //
analyzed: ba lang sna ni chu srin 'dra //
translated: The ox nose is like a crocodile.

original: shes bya rgyud shes me stag 'dra //
analyzed: shes bya rgyud shes me stag 'dra //
translated: The knower is like a fire spark.

original: de nyid bskor ba glog phreng ste //
analyzed: de nyid bskor ba glog phreng ste //
translated: That itself is the circle, like a garland of lightning.

original: bla 'og lto sbyar sprin phyag rgya //
analyzed: bla 'og lto sbyar sprin phyag rgya //
translated: The hands joined back to back, the fingers interlaced like clouds,

original: de dag snying po'i phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: de dag snying po'i phyag rgya ste //
translated: are the heart mudras.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'ang de dag go //🔽zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'ang de dag go // zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: They are also the action mudras.

original: gza' brgyad kyi phyag rgya yongs su gsung spa ste /
analyzed: gza' brgyad kyi phyag rgya yongs su gsung spa ste /
translated: This teaches the mudras of the eight planets.

original: de la lag pa gnyis rgyab sprad de sor mo rnams phan tshun lto sbyar nas 'khor lo 'dra bar byas pa ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de la lag pa gnyis rgyab sprad de sor mo rnams phan tshun lto sbyar nas 'khor lo 'dra bar byas pa ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The sun mudra is made by joining the two hands back to back, the fingers interlaced like a wheel.

original: thal mo dam por sbyar nas sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ni zla ba'i phyag rgya'o //🔽lag pa g-yon pa'i gung mo dang mthe bong rtse sprad de phyir bstan la /
analyzed: thal mo dam por sbyar nas sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ni zla ba'i phyag rgya'o // lag pa g-yon pa'i gung mo dang mthe bong rtse sprad de phyir bstan la /
translated: The moon mudra is made by joining the palms tightly together, the fingers like rays of light.🔽The Rahu mudra is made by joining the left middle finger and thumb, turning them outward,

original: g-yas @193b pa'i gung mo'i tshigs dang mthe bong gnyis kyi bar du mdzub mo bcug la mchu'i thabs kar tshigs dbyung ba ltar byed pa ste de ni gza' ltag gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: g-yas @193b pa'i gung mo'i tshigs dang mthe bong gnyis kyi bar du mdzub mo bcug la mchu'i thabs kar tshigs dbyung ba ltar byed pa ste de ni gza' ltag gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and inserting the right middle finger between the joints of the right thumb and middle finger, like the beak of a bird.

original: lag pa gnyis mnyam par sbyar ba las dpung ba g-yon pa'i khar bzhag pa ni pa ba sangs kyi bkra shis kyi thal mo'i phyag rgya'o //🔽lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs la sdigs mdzub snying gar bsgreng ste g-yas pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan rnams bu gur byas la steng du phyar ba ni spen pa dbyug pa 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽lag pa gnyis par ba bzed pas chu srin gyi sna 'dra bar byas nas phrag pa gnyis kyi steng du phyar ba ni sgra gcan 'dzin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis mnyam par sbyar ba las dpung ba g-yon pa'i khar bzhag pa ni pa ba sangs kyi bkra shis kyi thal mo'i phyag rgya'o // lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs la sdigs mdzub snying gar bsgreng ste g-yas pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan rnams bu gur byas la steng du phyar ba ni spen pa dbyug pa 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya'o // lag pa gnyis par ba bzed pas chu srin gyi sna 'dra bar byas nas phrag pa gnyis kyi steng du phyar ba ni sgra gcan 'dzin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of the auspiciousness of Mercury is formed by placing the two hands together, with the left arm placed on the left shoulder.🔽The mudrā of the club-holding Saturn is formed by making the left hand into a fist with the index finger extended and the other fingers in a tube, and raising it to the heart.🔽The mudrā of Rāhu is formed by making the two hands into cupped palms like the snout of a crocodile, and raising them above the two shoulders.

original: lag pa gnyis sor mo phan tshun du bsnol te lag pa'i zur gnyis sbyar nas mthe bong dang sor mo thams cad me stag byas nas thal mo nang phye la g-yas pas g-yon du bskor ba ni mig dmar gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sor mo phan tshun du bsnol te lag pa'i zur gnyis sbyar nas mthe bong dang sor mo thams cad me stag byas nas thal mo nang phye la g-yas pas g-yon du bskor ba ni mig dmar gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Aṅgāraka is formed by interlacing the fingers of the two hands, joining the two sides of the hands, making all the fingers and thumbs into sparks, opening the palms, and turning the right hand over the left.

original: lag pa gnyis lto sbyar nas mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis phan tshun du rtse sprad de spyi gtsug gi nor bu ltar byas nas gzhan rnams so sor brkyang ba ni phur bu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis lto sbyar nas mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis phan tshun du rtse sprad de spyi gtsug gi nor bu ltar byas nas gzhan rnams so sor brkyang ba ni phur bu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of the kīla is to join the palms together, with the thumbs and little fingers touching each other, like a crown jewel on the crown of the head, while the other fingers are extended.

original: snying po'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste de nyid 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: snying po'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste de nyid 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kho na'o //
translated: The mudra of the essence is the pledge mudra, which is the pledge mudra of the worldly deities.

original: de nyid las srin lag dang mdzub mo gnyis bcings pa ni phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las srin lag dang mdzub mo gnyis bcings pa ni phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that, the index and ring fingers are bound, which is the mudra of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba'i tshigs par ma bcag pa ni dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba'i tshigs par ma bcag pa ni dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pa'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: From that, the index and ring fingers are not bound, which is the mudra for bestowing empowerment.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya yin no //
translated: That is also the mudra of Ākāśagarbha.

original: de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba bsdams pa la'ang srin lag padma 'dra par byas pa 'di ni padma las byung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba bsdams pa la'ang srin lag padma 'dra par byas pa 'di ni padma las byung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The same text says, “Hum is the binding. The ring fingers are like a lotus; this is the mudra of the lotus-born.

original: / dhri zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te bsgreng ba ni rdo rje bdams pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: / dhri zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te bsgreng ba ni rdo rje bdams pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Dhrīḥ is the two fingers side by side and erect; this is the mudra of the vajra palm.

original: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni bde ba chen po'i phyag rya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni bde ba chen po'i phyag rya'o //
translated: The same mudra with the fingers like a lotus is the mudra of great bliss.

original: de nyid las 'od zer 'phro ba'i tshul du byas pa ni kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'od zer 'phro ba'i tshul du byas pa ni kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The same mudra with the fingers radiating light is the mudra of Samantabhadra.

original: de nyid las de gnyis nang du bkug pa ni khro bo sna tshogs gzi brjid chen po'i phyag rgya'o zhes gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid las de gnyis nang du bkug pa ni khro bo sna tshogs gzi brjid chen po'i phyag rgya'o zhes gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: The same mudra with the two fingers drawn in is the mudra of the wrathful one, the great splendor of diversity.”

original: de la dang po sor mo rnams rdo rje bsdams pa las @194a * //
analyzed: de la dang po sor mo rnams rdo rje bsdams pa las @194a * //
translated: The first of these is the vajra binding.

original: gung mo gnyis gshibs nas bsgreng ste rdo rje ltar byas pa ste /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis gshibs nas bsgreng ste rdo rje ltar byas pa ste /
translated: The two middle fingers are side by side and erect, like a vajra.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi.

original: gnyis pa ni gung mo snga ma ltar byas la de'i ngos la mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gung mo snga ma ltar byas la de'i ngos la mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas pa ste /
translated: The second is the same as the first, with the index fingers of both hands made like a jewel.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor la phyag rgya 'debs pa'i skabs su shes par bya ste de nyid bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor la phyag rgya 'debs pa'i skabs su shes par bya ste de nyid bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be known in the context of sealing the worldly maṇḍala. It should be known as the seal of Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nyid tshe dpag med kyi snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su ni nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid tshe dpag med kyi snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su ni nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the context of the maṇḍala of the essence of Amitāyus, it should be known as the seal of Ākāśagarbha.

original: gsum pa ni gung mo snga ma ltar byas pa srin lag gnyis rtse sprad de dgu por byas shing padma'i 'dab ma lta bur byas te de ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gung mo snga ma ltar byas pa srin lag gnyis rtse sprad de dgu por byas shing padma'i 'dab ma lta bur byas te de ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The third is the same as the first, with the two ring fingers touching and bent like the petals of a lotus. This is the seal of Avalokiteśvara.

original: bzhi pa ni sor mo rnams bsngags pa las srin lag gnyis rdo rje ltar bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sor mo rnams bsngags pa las srin lag gnyis rdo rje ltar bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the same as the first, with the two ring fingers erect like a vajra.

original: lnga pa ni gung mo snga ma lta bu las srin lag padma ltar rtse sprad de bkug pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gung mo snga ma lta bu las srin lag padma ltar rtse sprad de bkug pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The fifth is like the previous one, but the ring fingers are folded in like a lotus. These are to be known in the context of the maṇḍala of Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi.

original: drug pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol nas brkyang ste 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: drug pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol nas brkyang ste 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ste /
translated: The sixth is the fingers extended and crossed with each other, like rays of light.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o ;
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o ;
translated: That is the mudrā of Bhagavān Amitāyus Samantabhadra.

original: / bdun pa ni de nyid nang du bkug nas mthe bong gnyis mche ba lta bur bsgreng ba ste de ni khro bo khams gsum rnams par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: / bdun pa ni de nyid nang du bkug nas mthe bong gnyis mche ba lta bur bsgreng ba ste de ni khro bo khams gsum rnams par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The seventh is that very [mudrā] drawn in, with the two thumbs raised like fangs. That is the mudrā of the wrathful conqueror of the three worlds.

original: de nyid las shin tu bsngags pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las shin tu bsngags pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
translated: That very [mudrā] with the thumbs pressed together is the vajra bond.

original: brkyang pa ni srung ba'i'o //
analyzed: brkyang pa ni srung ba'i'o //
translated: The extended [mudrā] is the protection [mudrā].

original: h'um zhes bya ba'i so ni gnod sbyin gyi'o ;
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba'i so ni gnod sbyin gyi'o ;
translated: The “hum” teeth are for yakṣas.

original: / h'um zhes bya ba gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas pa ni rgyal po'i'o //
analyzed: / h'um zhes bya ba gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas pa ni rgyal po'i'o //
translated: The two “hum” [mudrās] made like hooks are for kings.

original: de nyid mda' ltar byas pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mda' ltar byas pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: That very [mudra] made like an arrow is the desire [mudra].

original: aom zhes bya ba gnyis sbyor ba ni legs pa'i'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba gnyis sbyor ba ni legs pa'i'o //
translated: The union of the two, OṀ, is the excellent [mudra].

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor du byas pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor du byas pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: That very [mudra] made into a circle is the splendor [mudra].

original: de nyid nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o ;
analyzed: de nyid nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o ;
translated: That very [mudra] made like a jewel is the victory banner [mudra].

original: / de nyid rgya gram du byas pa ni las kyi'o //
analyzed: / de nyid rgya gram du byas pa ni las kyi'o //
translated: That very [mudra] made into a cross is the action [mudra].

original: de nyid rin po che ltar bskor ba ni rin chen gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid rin po che ltar bskor ba ni rin chen gyi'o //
translated: That very [mudra] turned like a jewel is the jewel [mudra].

original: gung mo sbyar la sor mo bzhi brkyang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: gung mo sbyar la sor mo bzhi brkyang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
translated: The four fingers extended from the joined thumbs is the Vajrasattva [mudra].

original: de nyid khar gzhag pa ni dgyes pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid khar gzhag pa ni dgyes pa'i'o //
translated: That very [mudra] placed at the mouth is the delight [mudra].

original: thal mo padma ltar bkug pa ni padma'i'o //
analyzed: thal mo padma ltar bkug pa ni padma'i'o //
translated: The folded palms like a lotus is the lotus [mudra].

original: aa @194b zhes bya ba dang aom zhes bya ba gnyis nang du bkug pa ni ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: aa @194b zhes bya ba dang aom zhes bya ba gnyis nang du bkug pa ni ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two, AḤ and OṀ, folded inside is the sword mudra.

original: gcig la gcig sbyar ba ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sbyar ba ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mutual union is the wheel mudra.

original: snga ma las aom zhes bya ba ni gnyis khar gzhag pa ni tshig dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma las aom zhes bya ba ni gnyis khar gzhag pa ni tshig dbyung ba ste /
translated: From the previous, OṀ is the two placed at the mouth, the utterance.

original: mdor na phyag rgya 'di dag ni las thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'dir ye shes kyi sems dpa' bcu drug gi las kyi phyag rgya rnams te /
analyzed: mdor na phyag rgya 'di dag ni las thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'dir ye shes kyi sems dpa' bcu drug gi las kyi phyag rgya rnams te /
translated: In brief, these seals bestow all activities.

original: de la dang po ni khro bo'i phyag rgya las mthe bong gnyis phan tshun du bsnol nas khu tshur du bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni khro bo'i phyag rgya las mthe bong gnyis phan tshun du bsnol nas khu tshur du bsdams pa'o //
translated: The first is the seal of wrath. The two thumbs cross each other and are bound in a fist.

original: gnyis pa ni go cha'i tshul du sor mo rnams brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni go cha'i tshul du sor mo rnams brkyang ba'o //
translated: The second is the seal of armor. The fingers are extended in the manner of armor.

original: gsum pa ni mdzub mo gnyis mche ba ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mdzub mo gnyis mche ba ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The third is the seal of the fangs. The two index fingers are made like fangs.

original: bzhi pa ni mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu ltar byas ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the seal of the iron hook. The two index fingers are made like iron hooks.

original: lnga pa ni lag pa g-yas pa'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis gzhu ltar byas la /
analyzed: lnga pa ni lag pa g-yas pa'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis gzhu ltar byas la /
translated: The fifth is the seal of the arrow. The right hand makes the index finger and thumb like a bow,

original: g-yon pa'i mdzub mo de'i steng du mda' gtong ba ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mdzub mo de'i steng du mda' gtong ba ltar byas pa'o //
translated: and the left index finger is made like an arrow shot from it.

original: drug pa ni mthe bong gnyis kyi rtse mo dang mdzum mo'i rtse mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni mthe bong gnyis kyi rtse mo dang mdzum mo'i rtse mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: The sixth is the seal of the arrow. The tips of the two thumbs and the tips of the two index fingers are joined.

original: bdun pa ni gung mo gnyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gung mo gnyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The seventh is to make the two middle fingers like the orb of the sun.

original: brgyad pa ni mdzub mo gnyis spyi gtsug gi nor bu ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni mdzub mo gnyis spyi gtsug gi nor bu ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The eighth is to make the two index fingers like the crest jewel of the crown.

original: dgu pa ni mthe'u chung gnyis rgya gram du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pa ni mthe'u chung gnyis rgya gram du byas pa'o //
translated: The ninth is to make the two little fingers like a cross.

original: bcu pa ni gung mo gnyis rin po che'i rtse mo ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni gung mo gnyis rin po che'i rtse mo ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The tenth is to make the two middle fingers like the tip of a jewel.

original: bcu gcig pa ni mthe bong gnyis dang sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol ba las so sor brkyang nas khar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni mthe bong gnyis dang sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol ba las so sor brkyang nas khar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is to cross the thumb and fingers, extend them individually, and place them in the mouth.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni srin lag gnyis rtse sprad de padma'i 'dab ma ltar bkug pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni srin lag gnyis rtse sprad de padma'i 'dab ma ltar bkug pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is to touch the tips of the two ring fingers and bend them like the petals of a lotus.

original: bcu gsum pa ni mthe bong dang dang mthe'u chung gnyis nang du bkug nas sor mo gsum lto sbyar te brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni mthe bong dang dang mthe'u chung gnyis nang du bkug nas sor mo gsum lto sbyar te brkyang ba'o //
translated: The thirteenth is to bend the thumb and little finger inward, join the three fingers, and extend them.

original: bcu bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sbyar nas sor mo rnams rtse sprad pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sbyar nas sor mo rnams rtse sprad pa'o //
translated: The fourteenth is to join the two hands back to back and touch the fingers together.

original: bcom lnga pa ni mthe bong gnyis gshibs nas bsgrengs nas khar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom lnga pa ni mthe bong gnyis gshibs nas bsgrengs nas khar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth is to place the two extended thumbs at the mouth.

original: bcu drug pa ni gung mo gnyis gshibs nas mthe bong gnyis so sor brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa ni gung mo gnyis gshibs nas mthe bong gnyis so sor brkyang ba'o //
translated: The sixteenth is the two middle fingers side by side, with the two thumbs extended individually.

original: de dag ni zhi ba la sogs pa las kyi bye brag las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir dang lha rnams kyi dam tshig yin pa'i phyir dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi ba la sogs pa las kyi bye brag las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir dang lha rnams kyi dam tshig yin pa'i phyir dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: These are called “pledge seals” because they are difficult to transgress due to the distinctions of the actions of pacifying and so forth, and because they are the pledges of the deities.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya'i tshogs so //
translated: This concludes the collection of supramundane seals.

original: @195a * // de nyid bsdus mdung sprul mgor gyur //
analyzed: @195a * // de nyid bsdus mdung sprul mgor gyur //
translated: That itself is the spear of the compendium, becoming the snake’s head.

original: dbang po sor gsum rdo rje ste //
analyzed: dbang po sor gsum rdo rje ste //
translated: The three joints of the index finger are the vajra.

original: gshin rje gung mo dbyug pa 'dra //
analyzed: gshin rje gung mo dbyug pa 'dra //
translated: The middle finger of Yamarī is like a club.

original: mthe'u chung bkug la mdzub zhags pa //
analyzed: mthe'u chung bkug la mdzub zhags pa //
translated: The little finger is bent, and the index finger is the noose.

original: chu lha'i phyag rgya yin par 'dod //
analyzed: chu lha'i phyag rgya yin par 'dod //
translated: This is held to be the seal of Varuṇa.

original: dbyug to ldan pa gnod sbyin te //
analyzed: dbyug to ldan pa gnod sbyin te //
translated: The one with a club is the yakṣa.

original: rtse gsum bde byed yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rtse gsum bde byed yin par 'dod //
translated: The trident is held to be that of Bhairava.

original: bhridgi ri ti lag brkyang ste //
analyzed: bhridgi ri ti lag brkyang ste //
translated: Bhṛkuṭī is the outstretched hand.

original: srin po yin ni khrag 'phrog pa //
analyzed: srin po yin ni khrag 'phrog pa //
translated: The rākṣasa is the one who steals blood.

original: lag pa bskor ba rlung gi ste //
analyzed: lag pa bskor ba rlung gi ste //
translated: The one with the circling hand is Vāyu.

original: bum pa gzhag pa nor gyi'o //
analyzed: bum pa gzhag pa nor gyi'o //
translated: The one with the placed vase is of wealth.

original: steng phyogs kun du 'od 'phro zhing //
analyzed: steng phyogs kun du 'od 'phro zhing //
translated: Light radiates upward in all directions.

original: pi wang g-yon thogs dri za'i'o //
analyzed: pi wang g-yon thogs dri za'i'o //
translated: The gandharva holds a lute in the left hand.

original: de ltar mthe'u chung ral gri 'dra ;
analyzed: de ltar mthe'u chung ral gri 'dra ;
translated: Thus, the little finger is like a sword,

original: / gung mo zhags par rnam par ldan //
analyzed: / gung mo zhags par rnam par ldan //
translated: and the middle finger is endowed with a noose.

original: mthe bong ne'u le'i rna 'dra byas //
analyzed: mthe bong ne'u le'i rna 'dra byas //
translated: The thumb is made like a monkey's ear.

original: mgo bo thod pa nag po ste //
analyzed: mgo bo thod pa nag po ste //
translated: The head is a black skull,

original: lag gnyis 'bar ba me 'bar 'dra //
analyzed: lag gnyis 'bar ba me 'bar 'dra //
translated: and the two hands are like blazing fire.

original: rno la khro ba dbang dang ldan //
analyzed: rno la khro ba dbang dang ldan //
translated: Sharp and wrathful, it is endowed with power.

original: rlung gi phyag rgya mtshan ldan yin //
analyzed: rlung gi phyag rgya mtshan ldan yin //
translated: This is the characteristic of the wind mudra.

original: de la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams /
translated: These and other mudras

original: lag pas dgyes pas kun du spyod //
analyzed: lag pas dgyes pas kun du spyod //
translated: are enjoyed everywhere with the hand.

original: ces gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: This teaches the mudras of the three worldly mandalas.

original: dang po ni lag pa gnyis kyi mthe bong gnyis mdud la /
analyzed: dang po ni lag pa gnyis kyi mthe bong gnyis mdud la /
translated: First, tie the two thumbs of both hands,

original: mdzub mo gnyis rtse spangs pa gcig tu byas te lhag ma rnams so sor sprul mgo bzhin du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis rtse spangs pa gcig tu byas te lhag ma rnams so sor sprul mgo bzhin du byas pa ste /
translated: and make the two index fingers touch at the tips, making one, and the rest like the hoods of a snake.

original: de ni klu chen po brgyad kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ni klu chen po brgyad kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the pledge mudra of the eight great nagas.

original: gnyis pa ni phyogs skyong bcu'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyogs skyong bcu'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The second is the mudra of the ten direction protectors.

original: de la dang po ni mthe bong gis mthe'u chung mnan la lhag ma gsum rdo rje ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni mthe bong gis mthe'u chung mnan la lhag ma gsum rdo rje ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The first is to press the little finger with the thumb and make the remaining three fingers like a vajra.

original: gnyis pa ni gung mo gnyis thod dbyug ltar byas pa'o//
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gung mo gnyis thod dbyug ltar byas pa'o//
translated: The second is to make the two middle fingers like a skull staff.

original: gsum pa ni mthe bong dang gung mo zhags mig ltar byas la mdzub mo brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mthe bong dang gung mo zhags mig ltar byas la mdzub mo brkyang ba'o //
translated: The third is to make the thumb and middle finger like a lasso and extend the index finger.

original: bzhi pa ni mdzub mo dbyug to ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mdzub mo dbyug to ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The fourth is to make the index finger like a club.

original: lnga pa ni gung mo gnyis bsgreng ste mdzub mo gnyis so sor brkyang pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gung mo gnyis bsgreng ste mdzub mo gnyis so sor brkyang pa'o //
translated: The fifth is to raise the two middle fingers and extend the two index fingers individually.

original: drug pa ni sor mo rnams dgu par 'phyar ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni sor mo rnams dgu par 'phyar ba'o //
translated: The sixth is to wave the nine fingers.

original: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams dgu por byas pas 'phyar ba'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams dgu por byas pas 'phyar ba'o //
translated: The seventh is to wave the nine fingers together.

original: brgyad pa ni lag pa'i thal mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas yang nas yang du bskor ba'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni lag pa'i thal mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas yang nas yang du bskor ba'o //
translated: The eighth is to join the two palms together and rotate them again and again.

original: dgu pa ni lag pa gcig gi steng du gcig gzhag pa bum pa 'dzin pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pa ni lag pa gcig gi steng du gcig gzhag pa bum pa 'dzin pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: The ninth is to place one hand on top of the other, like holding a vase.

original: bcu pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol ba @195b las 'od zer ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol ba @195b las 'od zer ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The tenth is like a ray of light from the fingers crossed with each other.

original: gsum pa ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The third is the great king’s mudrā.

original: de la dang po ni lag pa g-yon pa rna ba'i rtsar bzung la g-yas pa'i gung mo dang mthe bong sbyar bas dkur gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni lag pa g-yon pa rna ba'i rtsar bzung la g-yas pa'i gung mo dang mthe bong sbyar bas dkur gzung ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first is holding the left hand at the ear, and holding it to the side with the middle finger and thumb of the right hand joined.

original: gnyis pa ni mthe'u chung rtse sprad de ral gri ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mthe'u chung rtse sprad de ral gri ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The second is the two little fingers touching, like a sword.

original: gsum pa ni gung mo brkyang ba zhags pa ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gung mo brkyang ba zhags pa ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The third is the middle finger extended, like a noose.

original: bzhi pa ni mthe bong gnyis tshigs par ma bcag pas phral te so sor phyar ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mthe bong gnyis tshigs par ma bcag pas phral te so sor phyar ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the two thumbs not bent at the joint, but separated and raised.

original: lhag ma bzhi ni gshin rje dang / me lha dang / dbang ldan dang / rlung gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi ni gshin rje dang / me lha dang / dbang ldan dang / rlung gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The remaining four are the pledge seals of Yama, Agni, Īśāna, and Vāyu.

original: de la dang po ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams yongs su bsdus shing bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams yongs su bsdus shing bskor ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first is the fingers of the hand completely gathered and turned.

original: gnyis pa ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams bsnol zhing brkyang pa las me stag 'dra bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams bsnol zhing brkyang pa las me stag 'dra bar byas pa'o //
translated: The second is made by extending the fingers of the hands crossed and resembling sparks.

original: gsum pa ni gung mo dang srin lag dang mdzub mo rnams rtse gsum pa ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gung mo dang srin lag dang mdzub mo rnams rtse gsum pa ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The third is made by the middle, ring, and index fingers like three points.

original: bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis kyi srin lag gi rtse sprad la gung mo dang mdzub mo gnyis so sor gshibs pas brkyang ste mthe'u chung gnyis de bzhin du rtse sprad nas ba dan 'phyar ba ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis kyi srin lag gi rtse sprad la gung mo dang mdzub mo gnyis so sor gshibs pas brkyang ste mthe'u chung gnyis de bzhin du rtse sprad nas ba dan 'phyar ba ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The fourth is made by extending the tips of the ring fingers of both hands, the middle and index fingers of each extended separately, and the two little fingers likewise joined at the tips, like a banner being waved.

original: de la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams //
translated: Such are the mudras.

original: lag pa skyes pas kun du spyod //
analyzed: lag pa skyes pas kun du spyod //
translated: The hands are employed by the male.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This means:

original: gzhan yang gang dang gang du phyag rgya'i tshogs kyis mngon par sbyong ba de nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgyas mchod pa dang dgyes par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dang gang du phyag rgya'i tshogs kyis mngon par sbyong ba de nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgyas mchod pa dang dgyes par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, wherever the assembly of mudras is applied, one should worship and delight with the mudra that accords with that.🔽The lotus mudra is auspicious

original: lha rnams kun gyi thun mong du //🔽padma'i phyag rgya bkra shis te //
analyzed: lha rnams kun gyi thun mong du //🔽padma'i phyag rgya bkra shis te //
translated: for all the deities in common.

original: klu rnams phyag rgya autpala la //
analyzed: klu rnams phyag rgya autpala la //
translated: The nāgas’ mudrā is the utpala.

original: de ltar so ni gnod sbyin rnams //
analyzed: de ltar so ni gnod sbyin rnams //
translated: Thus the yakṣas’ is the finger.

original: srin po rnams kyi mgo tshal ba //
analyzed: srin po rnams kyi mgo tshal ba //
translated: The rākṣasas’ is the head-splitting.

original: bud med rnams kyi sor bcu bsnol //🔽gza' rnams kyi ni dbyug pa ste //
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi sor bcu bsnol // gza' rnams kyi ni dbyug pa ste //
translated: The women’s is the ten fingers crossed.🔽The planets’ is the club.

original: aargha dbul ba rgyu skar rnams //
analyzed: aargha dbul ba rgyu skar rnams //
translated: The asterisms’ is the offering of argha.

original: mgo bo'i thod pa khar gzhag pa'i //
analyzed: mgo bo'i thod pa khar gzhag pa'i //
translated: The skull on the head placed in the mouth

original: phyag rgya 'di ni phra men ma'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di ni phra men ma'o //
translated: is the mudrā of the piśācis.

original: mgo thod lce yi phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: mgo thod lce yi phyag rgya ni //
translated: The skull on the head with the tongue

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma yi rab bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma yi rab bshad //
translated: is explained as Vajrayoginī’s.

original: ces gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bsdus nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bsdus nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the Bhagavān’s concise teaching of the mudrās of the worldly gods.

original: de la dang po ni lag pa gnyis phan tshun du sor mo rnams rtse sprad pa blas padma dkar po'i tshul du byas pa ste de ni bkra shis kyi rdzas dang lha @196a * //
analyzed: de la dang po ni lag pa gnyis phan tshun du sor mo rnams rtse sprad pa blas padma dkar po'i tshul du byas pa ste de ni bkra shis kyi rdzas dang lha @196a * //
translated: Therein, the first is the two hands with the fingers touching each other at the tips, made in the manner of a white lotus. That is the auspicious substance and the deity’s mudrā.

original: dang lha'i bu mo thams cad kun rtse zhing rol pa na bdud rtsi padma las longs spyod pa'i phyir na lha thams cad kyi thun mong du padma'i phyag rgya bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dang lha'i bu mo thams cad kun rtse zhing rol pa na bdud rtsi padma las longs spyod pa'i phyir na lha thams cad kyi thun mong du padma'i phyag rgya bshad pa'o //
translated: Since all the gods and goddesses play and enjoy themselves with the lotus of nectar, the lotus seal is explained as being common to all the gods.

original: gnyis pa ni lag pa gnyis kyi gung mo dang srin lag rtse sprad pa sbyar te bsgreng nas mthe'u chung phyir sbyar te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lag pa gnyis kyi gung mo dang srin lag rtse sprad pa sbyar te bsgreng nas mthe'u chung phyir sbyar te /
translated: The second is to join the middle and ring fingers of both hands, raise them up, and join the two little fingers.

original: mdzub mo gnyis gong ma'i tshigs dang po sbyar nas bkug pa ste de ni klu rnams thams cad nam mkha' lding gi 'jigs pa las 'phags pa 'jam dpal la klu'i rgyal po dga' bos autpala'i phreng ba phul nas slar zhus te byin gyis brlabs pa las klu rnams
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis gong ma'i tshigs dang po sbyar nas bkug pa ste de ni klu rnams thams cad nam mkha' lding gi 'jigs pa las 'phags pa 'jam dpal la klu'i rgyal po dga' bos autpala'i phreng ba phul nas slar zhus te byin gyis brlabs pa las klu rnams
translated: The two index fingers are joined at the first joint and bent. This is the utpala seal. When the nāga king Nanda offered a garland of utpalas to Mañjuśrī, who had saved all the nāgas from the fear of Garuḍa, and requested [Mañjuśrī] to bless [him], [Mañjuśrī] blessed him.

original: kun du bsrung ba'i phyir klu dang klu'i bu mo rnams dus thams cad du autpala 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i phyir klu dang klu'i bu mo rnams dus thams cad du autpala 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect all the nāgas, the nāgas and nāga girls always hold utpalas.

original: klu thams cad kyi thun mong du autpala'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: klu thams cad kyi thun mong du autpala'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the utpala seal is explained as being common to all the nāgas.

original: gsum pa ni mdzub mo gnyis bsnol te kha'i thad kar mche ba ltar bya ba dang mthe'u chung gnyis 'og tu mche ba ltar byas pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni mdzub mo gnyis bsnol te kha'i thad kar mche ba ltar bya ba dang mthe'u chung gnyis 'og tu mche ba ltar byas pa ste /
translated: The third is to cross the two index fingers and make them like fangs in front of the mouth, and to make the two little fingers like fangs below.

original: de ni gnod sbyin rnams sems can rnams kyi srog gcod cing sha rnams za ba'i mche ba gdug pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gnod sbyin thams cad kyi thun mong du mche ba'i phyag rgyar bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gnod sbyin rnams sems can rnams kyi srog gcod cing sha rnams za ba'i mche ba gdug pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gnod sbyin thams cad kyi thun mong du mche ba'i phyag rgyar bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the fang mudra common to all yakshas because they have fangs that are poisonous, cutting the life of sentient beings and eating their flesh.

original: bzhi pa ni lag pa phan tshun sor mo rnams legs par mdud cing mthe bong gnyis ni mig ltar byas pa ste /🔽de ni srin mo rnams rtag tu mi'i thod pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni lag pa phan tshun sor mo rnams legs par mdud cing mthe bong gnyis ni mig ltar byas pa ste / de ni srin mo rnams rtag tu mi'i thod pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: The fourth is to interlace the fingers of the two hands and make the two thumbs like eyes.

original: srin po thams cad kyi thun mong du mgo bo'i thod pa dum bu'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: srin po thams cad kyi thun mong du mgo bo'i thod pa dum bu'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained as the skull mudra common to all rakshasas because the rakshasis always enjoy human skulls.

original: lnga pa ni ma mo rnams kyi sta lag pa rnams kyi sor mo bcu phan tshun du bsnol ba ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni ma mo rnams kyi sta lag pa rnams kyi sor mo bcu phan tshun du bsnol ba ste /
translated: The fifth is the mudra of the ten fingers of the two hands crossed in the manner of the ten mothers.

original: de ni ma mo rnams kyi 'khrig pa'i chos la nye bar brten pa'i phyir na bud med thams cad kyi thun mong du sor mo bcu phan tshun du bsnol nas brang du bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma mo rnams kyi 'khrig pa'i chos la nye bar brten pa'i phyir na bud med thams cad kyi thun mong du sor mo bcu phan tshun du bsnol nas brang du bzung ba'o //
translated: Since it is based on the sexual practice of the mātṛkās, it is the common mudrā of all women, holding the ten fingers crossed and placed on the chest.

original: drug pa ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams bsdams pa las mdzub mo g-yas pa dbyug pa ltar phyar ba ste /
analyzed: drug pa ni lag pa'i sor mo rnams bsdams pa las mdzub mo g-yas pa dbyug pa ltar phyar ba ste /
translated: The sixth is the mudrā of the club, formed by clenching the fingers and raising the right index finger like a club.

original: de ni gza' rnams lha ma yin gyi 'jigs pa thams cad bzlog pa'i ched du rin po che'i dbyug pa 'dzin pa'i phyir gza' rnams kyi thun mong du dbyug pa'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gza' rnams lha ma yin gyi 'jigs pa thams cad bzlog pa'i ched du rin po che'i dbyug pa 'dzin pa'i phyir gza' rnams kyi thun mong du dbyug pa'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
translated: Since it is the club of jewels held by the planets in order to avert all the dangers of the asuras, it is explained as the common mudrā of the planets.

original: bdun pa ni lag pa gnyis zur sbyar la sor mo rnams rtse @196b sprad de mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i ngos la sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni lag pa gnyis zur sbyar la sor mo rnams rtse @196b sprad de mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i ngos la sbyar ba ste /
translated: The seventh is the mudrā of the lotus, formed by joining the two hands and touching the tips of the fingers, with the two thumbs touching the sides of the index fingers.

original: de ni rgyu skar rnams rang rang gi bdag po la zhabs bsil gyi dus kun du bsnyen bkur byed ba'i phyir skar ma'i lha mo thams cad kyi thun mong du aargha dbul ba'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu skar rnams rang rang gi bdag po la zhabs bsil gyi dus kun du bsnyen bkur byed ba'i phyir skar ma'i lha mo thams cad kyi thun mong du aargha dbul ba'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
translated: It is explained as the common mudra for all the star goddesses for the offering of argha, because the stars all serve their lords with the water for washing the feet at all times.

original: brgyad pa ni sor mo rnams bsnol ba las gung mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis tshigs bkug la mthe bong gis mdzub mo mnan la khar bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni sor mo rnams bsnol ba las gung mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis tshigs bkug la mthe bong gis mdzub mo mnan la khar bzhag pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the mudra of the skull cup filled with blood, formed by interlacing the fingers, bending the middle and little fingers, and pressing the thumb on the index finger and placing it in the mouth.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi mkha' 'gro ma thod pa khrag gis bkang ba 'thung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi mkha' 'gro ma thod pa khrag gis bkang ba 'thung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is explained as the common mudra for all the dakinis for drinking the skull cup filled with blood of the worldly dakinis.

original: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi thun mong du mgo bo'i thod pa khar gzhag pa'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi thun mong du mgo bo'i thod pa khar gzhag pa'i phyag rgyar bshad pa'o //
translated: It is explained as the mudra of placing the skull on the head in the mouth for all the dakinis.

original: dgu pa ni de nyid las srin lag gnyis rtse sprad nas lce 'dra bar byas pa ste de ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma thams cad mgo rlon pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir mgo rlon pa lce dang bcas pa'i phyag rgya bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pa ni de nyid las srin lag gnyis rtse sprad nas lce 'dra bar byas pa ste de ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma thams cad mgo rlon pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir mgo rlon pa lce dang bcas pa'i phyag rgya bshad pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the same, except that the two ring fingers are joined at the tips to form a tongue. This is explained as the mudra of the head with a tongue, because all Vajrayoginis enjoy the head.

original: de nas kun gyi thun mong du //
analyzed: de nas kun gyi thun mong du //
translated: Then, in common for all,

original: phyag rgya chen po bshad par bya //🔽thal mo brkyang ba byas pa'am //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bshad par bya // thal mo brkyang ba byas pa'am //
translated: the great mudra is explained.🔽The palms are extended

original: yang na thal mo padmor bya //
analyzed: yang na thal mo padmor bya //
translated: or the palms are made into a lotus.

original: rdo rje'i khu tshur bcings nas kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje'i khu tshur bcings nas kyang //
translated: Having made the vajra-fists,

original: aa:zhes bya ba lu gu rgyud //
analyzed: aa:zhes bya ba lu gu rgyud //
translated: the A and the chain of A's,

original: h'um zhes bya ba gnyis bsgreng la //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba gnyis bsgreng la //
translated: the two HŪMs are erected,

original: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya yin //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya yin //
translated: which is the mudra of Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje bcings pas bsdams nas kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje bcings pas bsdams nas kyang //
translated: Having bound with the vajra binding,

original: h'um dang aa:gnyis gshibs nas bsgrod //🔽aom zhes bya bas ngos sbyar ba'i //
analyzed: h'um dang aa:gnyis gshibs nas bsgrod // aom zhes bya bas ngos sbyar ba'i //
translated: the two HŪMs and Aḥs are placed side by side,

original: phyag rgya snang bar byed par dgongs //
analyzed: phyag rgya snang bar byed par dgongs //
translated: and with OṀ, the mudra is considered to illuminate.

original: de la aa:zhes bya bas bcing //
analyzed: de la aa:zhes bya bas bcing //
translated: There, the Aḥ is bound with the A.

original: aom zhes bya bas nang du gzhug / h'um zhes bya bas sngon bzhin bya //
analyzed: aom zhes bya bas nang du gzhug / h'um zhes bya bas sngon bzhin bya //
translated: With HŪṀ, one should do as before.

original: tram yang h'um dang 'dra bar bya //
analyzed: tram yang h'um dang 'dra bar bya //
translated: TRAM is also like HŪṀ.

original: gshin rje gshed po'i phyag rgya yin //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po'i phyag rgya yin //
translated: This is the mudra of Yamântaka.

original: tram zhes bya ba gshibs nas ni //
analyzed: tram zhes bya ba gshibs nas ni //
translated: With TRAM, one should be in union;

original: aa dang aom gnyis lu gu rgyud //
analyzed: aa dang aom gnyis lu gu rgyud //
translated: With A and OṀ, one should be in a chain.

original: lhag ma gshibs pa'i phyag rgya 'di //🔽bdud rtsi 'khyil par shes par bya //
analyzed: lhag ma gshibs pa'i phyag rgya 'di // bdud rtsi 'khyil par shes par bya //
translated: The remaining mudra is in union;🔽One should know it as Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: tram zhes bya bar gshibs nas ni //🔽h'um zhes bya ba'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tram zhes bya bar gshibs nas ni // h'um zhes bya ba'ang de bzhin no //
translated: With TRAM, one should be in union;🔽With HŪṀ, one should do the same.

original: de ltar aa:zhes bya ba gshibs //
analyzed: de ltar aa:zhes bya ba gshibs //
translated: Thus, with AḤ, one should be in union;

original: ltag ma 'od zer 'dra bar bya //
analyzed: ltag ma 'od zer 'dra bar bya //
translated: The remaining one should be like a ray of light.

original: de ni rta mgrin phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: de ni rta mgrin phyag rgya ste //
translated: This is the mudra of Hayagrīva;

original: de dag las rnams kun la gsungs //
analyzed: de dag las rnams kun la gsungs //
translated: They are said to be for all activities.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni phyag rgya chen po bzhi dang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni phyag rgya chen po bzhi dang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: This teaches the four great mudrās and the mudra of Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi.

original: de la dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams la @197a * //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams la @197a * //
translated: The first is for the worldly deities.

original: phyag rgya chen po med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyas 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen por bsgyur ba ni de dag thams cad kyi lus kyi skabs su lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo brkyang ba'am /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyas 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen por bsgyur ba ni de dag thams cad kyi lus kyi skabs su lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo brkyang ba'am /
translated: Since there is no great seal, the Bhagavat Vajrapani transforms the great seals of the mundane deities with his seal.

original: padma 'dra bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: padma 'dra bar bya ba ste //
translated: The two palms are extended or made like a lotus.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lha rnams gus pa dang bcas pa'i mchod pa'i rdzas kyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir lag pa brkyang ba dang padma 'dra bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lha rnams gus pa dang bcas pa'i mchod pa'i rdzas kyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir lag pa brkyang ba dang padma 'dra bar byas pa'o //
translated: This is the Bhagavat's extension of the hand and making like a lotus in order to honor with the offering substances of the deities with respect.

original: de las mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud du byas pa las lag pa rgyab sbyar te mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad nas gzhan rnams bkug cing mdzub mo gnyis rgyab sbrad nas bsgreng la snying gar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de las mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud du byas pa las lag pa rgyab sbyar te mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad nas gzhan rnams bkug cing mdzub mo gnyis rgyab sbrad nas bsgreng la snying gar bzung ba'o //
translated: From that, the two little fingers are made into a chain, the two palms are joined, the two thumbs are touching at the tips, the others are bent, the two index fingers are joined in the back, and it is held at the heart.

original: gnyis pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa la mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe bong gnyis gshibs la bsgreng ste mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i ngos la sbyar la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa la mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe bong gnyis gshibs la bsgreng ste mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i ngos la sbyar la /
translated: The second is to join the two index fingers and two thumbs of a vajra-binding, raise them up, and touch the thumbs to the sides of the index fingers.

original: thal mo kha bye bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: thal mo kha bye bar byas pa'o //
translated: Open the palms.

original: gsum pa ni sor mo rnams bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sor mo rnams bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis nang du bcug ste /
translated: The third is to join the fingers and insert the two thumbs inside.

original: mdzub mo dang gung mo gnyis gshibs la bsgrengs nas ral gri'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang gung mo gnyis gshibs la bsgrengs nas ral gri'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: The two index fingers and two middle fingers are joined and raised, made in the shape of a sword.

original: bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sbyar la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sbyar la /
translated: The fourth is to join the two hands back to back,

original: mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud du byas nas gung mo gnyis gshibs la bsgreng ba ste /
analyzed: mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud du byas nas gung mo gnyis gshibs la bsgreng ba ste /
translated: make a chain with the two thumbs and little fingers, join the two middle fingers, raise them up,

original: lhag ma rnams tshigs bar ma bcag la bkug pas snying gar gzung ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams tshigs bar ma bcag la bkug pas snying gar gzung ba'o //
translated: and hold them at the heart with the remaining fingers bent at the middle joints.

original: lnga pa ni gung mo dang mdzub mo gshibs la bsgreng ba ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni gung mo dang mdzub mo gshibs la bsgreng ba ste /
translated: The fifth is to join the two middle fingers and index fingers and raise them up.

original: mthe'u chung yang de bzhin du gshibs la bsgrengs nas srin lag dang mthe bo gnyis 'od zer 'dra bar byas la rta'i kha gdangs pa ltar byas pas spyi bor gzung ba'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung yang de bzhin du gshibs la bsgrengs nas srin lag dang mthe bo gnyis 'od zer 'dra bar byas la rta'i kha gdangs pa ltar byas pas spyi bor gzung ba'o //
translated: The little fingers are also placed together and extended, and the ring fingers and thumbs are made like light rays, and the hands are opened like a horse's mouth.

original: de dag ni 'dir gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bzhi zhes par 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dir gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bzhi zhes par 'dod de /
translated: Those are asserted to be the four great mudras taught here.

original: @197b de dag las rnams kun las gsungs //🔽zhes pa nyid do //

analyzed: zhes pa ni rigs kyi yum bzhi'i phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: These are the gestures of the four mothers of the families.

original: de la de dag gi mdzub mo dang gung mo so sor brkyang zhing srin lag mdud pas mig 'dra bar byas pa dang / gung mo rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa dang de nyid padma 'dra bar byas pa dang sor mo rnams bsdus nas brkyang bas autpala 'dra bar byas pa'o //

translated: There, the index and middle fingers are extended individually, and the ring fingers are crossed to form an eye-like shape, the middle fingers are made like a vajra, that [hand] is made like a lotus, and the fingers are gathered and extended to form an utpala.

analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re h'um h'um h'um h'um h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis las kyi tshogs thams cad khyab par 'jug pa'i yig 'bru rnams gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One has taught the syllables that pervade all the collections of activities here.

original: de sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa dan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal po 'dis sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las sgrol zhing de'i dkyil 'khor dang lha rnams ni gong du gsungs pa de'i
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa dan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyal po 'dis sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las sgrol zhing de'i dkyil 'khor dang lha rnams ni gong du gsungs pa de'i
translated: For the benefit of all sentient beings means that all sentient beings are purified by this king of maṇḍalas of the tathāgatas and liberated from the ocean of suffering.

original: skyed par byed pa'i yig 'bru dang / las so so'i sngags rnams ma gsungs pa'i phyir gsungs la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i yig 'bru dang / las so so'i sngags rnams ma gsungs pa'i phyir gsungs la /
translated: The syllables that generate the maṇḍala and the mantras of the individual activities are not mentioned, and so they are mentioned here.

original: de nyid gang dag la yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub thob par byed pa'i thabs bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir na sems can thams cad la phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gang dag la yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub thob par byed pa'i thabs bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir na sems can thams cad la phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is the unsurpassed method for attaining perfect complete enlightenment, it is called “for the benefit of all sentient beings.”

original: las thams cad grub par byed pa ni dper na srub mkhan gyis bsrubs pa'i lcags lta bus 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las dang @198a * //
analyzed: las thams cad grub par byed pa ni dper na srub mkhan gyis bsrubs pa'i lcags lta bus 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las dang @198a * //
translated: Accomplishing all activities is like a blacksmith’s bellows, which accomplish mundane and transcendent activities.

original: dngos grub thams cad ma lus par rdzogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ma lus par rdzogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the branch that perfects all powers without exception.

original: sngags kyi yig 'bru ni 'brur bkod pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi yig 'bru ni 'brur bkod pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The mantra syllables are the collection of syllables arranged in the seed syllables.

original: de dag nyid kyi thugs ka nas zhal du phyung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi thugs ka nas zhal du phyung ba nyid do //
translated: They are the very ones that emerge from the heart to the face.

original: de nyid gang yin snyam pa la yig 'bru drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gang yin snyam pa la yig 'bru drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thinking, “What is that?” the sixty-four syllables, and so on, are explained.

original: de la yig 'bru la sogs pa'i drug cu rtsa bzhi po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la yig 'bru la sogs pa'i drug cu rtsa bzhi po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The sixty-four syllables, and so on, are the dharmakāya of Bhagavān Vajrasattva, the essence free from all proliferation.

original: de nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru dang po gsungs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru gsum pa gsungs pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru bzhi pa gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru dang po gsungs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru gsum pa gsungs pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru bzhi pa gsungs pa dang /
translated: That is illustrated by the first syllable, the mirrorlike gnosis; the third syllable, the gnosis of uniformity; the fourth syllable, the individually discerning gnosis; and the fifth syllable, the gnosis of successful activities.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru gnyis pa gsungs pa dang / de nyid chos kyi tshul gyi sgo nas rdo rje sems dpa' rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la mtshon nas yig 'bru gnyis pa gsungs pa dang / de nyid chos kyi tshul gyi sgo nas rdo rje sems dpa' rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: And that very [syllable] becomes the four kinds of Vajrasattva through the method of Dharma.

original: ji lta bur 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji lta bur 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How does it become so?

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: In the Vairocana Tantra, the Blessed One said:

original: rgyu rkyen lam dang 'bras bu yis //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen lam dang 'bras bu yis //
translated: By cause, condition, path, and result,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bzhir 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bzhir 'gyur zhing //
translated: Vajrasattva becomes fourfold.🔽Because it is free from conceptualization, luminous,

original: rtog dang bral zhing 'od gsal dang // gzhig par mi nus kun 'joms phyir //
analyzed: rtog dang bral zhing 'od gsal dang // gzhig par mi nus kun 'joms phyir //
translated: cannot be destroyed, and conquers all,

original: rdo rje sems zhes brjod pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems zhes brjod pa yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is called Vajrasattva.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa des ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mtha' dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa des ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mtha' dag gsungs so //
translated: In that [verse], all the phenomena to be accomplished are taught.

original: de la de dag ni ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /🔽de ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni ngo bo gsungs so //
analyzed: de la de dag ni ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la / de ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni ngo bo gsungs so //
translated: Among them, what are they like?🔽In that [verse], the first half teaches the essence,

original: phyed kyis ni nges pa'i tshig gsungs te /
analyzed: phyed kyis ni nges pa'i tshig gsungs te /
translated: and the second half teaches the etymology.

original: de yang 'di ltar rgyu rdo rje sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la phan pa thog ma nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi sa bon yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar rgyu rdo rje sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la phan pa thog ma nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi sa bon yod pa nyid de /
translated: Furthermore, the cause Vajrasattva is the seed of nondual pristine consciousness, which has existed from the beginning for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de la thog ma med pa nas log par rtog pa'i dbang gis log par brtags pa'i dri ma de bzhig dka' ba'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya zhing de nyid sems kyi cha las byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la thog ma med pa nas log par rtog pa'i dbang gis log par brtags pa'i dri ma de bzhig dka' ba'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya zhing de nyid sems kyi cha las byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “vajra” because it is difficult to destroy the stains that are wrongly imagined through the power of wrong imagination from beginningless time, and it is called “sattva” because it arises from the aspect of mind.

original: rkyen rdo rje sems dpa' ni gang du byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa bskyed pa de ste /
analyzed: rkyen rdo rje sems dpa' ni gang du byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa bskyed pa de ste /
translated: The condition Vajrasattva is the generation of the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment.

original: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pa las log par rtog pa'i bag chags thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir @198b rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pa las log par rtog pa'i bag chags thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir @198b rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “vajra” because it destroys all the traces of wrong imagination through meditating on the true reality, and it is called “sattva” because it possesses the mind of enlightenment.

original: lam rdo rje sems dpa' ni gang du lha'i sku phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa de ste /
analyzed: lam rdo rje sems dpa' ni gang du lha'i sku phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa de ste /
translated: The path Vajrasattva is the meditation on the deity’s body, the great seal.

original: de nyid las rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid las rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because that very [vajra] is the source of the arising of non-conceptual consciousness,

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid sems kyi khyad par las byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid sems kyi khyad par las byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is called vajra and because it arises from the special mind, it is called sattva.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The resultant Vajrasattva is the dharmakāya,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing sems can thams cad kyi don du sku rnam pa gnyis la khyab pa'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid las sprul pa sna tshogs byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing sems can thams cad kyi don du sku rnam pa gnyis la khyab pa'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya ba dang / de nyid las sprul pa sna tshogs byung ba'i phyir sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: called vajra because it is naturally luminous and pervades the two kāyas for the benefit of all sentient beings, and called sattva because various emanations arise from it.

original: de dag gis ni bdud kyi sgyu ma'i tshogs ma lus par 'dul ba'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bdud kyi sgyu ma'i tshogs ma lus par 'dul ba'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba kho na'o //
translated: By those [names], it is called Great Vajrasattva alone because it completely subdues the entire host of Māra's illusions.

original: de nyid las phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa'i phyir yig 'bru bzhi gsungs la /
analyzed: de nyid las phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa'i phyir yig 'bru bzhi gsungs la /
translated: From that very [Vajrasattva], the four seed syllables are taught because it possesses the maṇḍala of the four types of activity.

original: de dag bcu drug tu gsungs pa ni ye shes kyi sems dpa' bcu drug la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bcu drug tu gsungs pa ni ye shes kyi sems dpa' bcu drug la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The statement that they are sixteen is a statement that the sixteen gnostics are endowed with the four seals of the maṇḍala.

original: de la h'um la sogs pa'i yig 'bru bcu drug po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: de la h'um la sogs pa'i yig 'bru bcu drug po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i snying po ste /
translated: The sixteen syllables such as hūṃ are the essence mantras of Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de nyid kyi mtshan la yig 'bru btags pa'i phyir sngags kyi snying po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan la yig 'bru btags pa'i phyir sngags kyi snying po zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called “essence mantras” because their names are designated by syllables.

original: de dag kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du h'um ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du h'um ni sems dpa'o //
translated: They are the following: hūṃ is the hero,

original: dzra ni rgyal po'o //
analyzed: dzra ni rgyal po'o //
translated: jra is the king,

original: ho ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: ho ni chags pa'o //
translated: ho is the passionate one,

original: dhu ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dhu ni legs pa'o //
translated: dhu is the good one,

original: tram ni rin chen gyi'o //
analyzed: tram ni rin chen gyi'o //
translated: traṃ is the jewel,

original: ram ni nyi ma'i'o //
analyzed: ram ni nyi ma'i'o //
translated: raṃ is the sun,

original: bhri ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
analyzed: bhri ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
translated: bhrūṃ is the banner,

original: ha ni bzhad pa'i'o //
analyzed: ha ni bzhad pa'i'o //
translated: ha is the laughing one,

original: hri ni chos kyi'o//
analyzed: hri ni chos kyi'o//
translated: hrīḥ is the Dharma,

original: dhi ni rnon po'i'o //
analyzed: dhi ni rnon po'i'o //
translated: dhi is the sharp one,

original: krum ni 'khor lo'i'o //
analyzed: krum ni 'khor lo'i'o //
translated: kṣuṃ is the wheel,

original: bha ni gsung ba'i'o //
analyzed: bha ni gsung ba'i'o //
translated: bha is the speech,

original: kam ni las kyi'o //
analyzed: kam ni las kyi'o //
translated: kaṃ is the action,

original: ram ni srung ba'i'o //
analyzed: ram ni srung ba'i'o //
translated: raṃ is the protector,

original: ksham ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
analyzed: ksham ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
translated: kṣaṃ is the yakṣa.

original: sam ni dam tshig gi snying por shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sam ni dam tshig gi snying por shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that samaya is the essence of commitment.🔽Moreover, it is said that each of them has four kinds of enlightened activity.

original: de dag kyang so so la phrin las rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par gsungs pa ni rgyal po dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rnon po dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyis ni mngon spyod kyi las mdzad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag kyang so so la phrin las rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par gsungs pa ni rgyal po dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rnon po dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyis ni mngon spyod kyi las mdzad pa nyid de /
translated: The king, banner, sharp weapon, and yakṣa perform the activity of wrath.

original: chags pa dang / bzhad pa dang / gsung ba dang / dam tshig rnams kyis ni dbang gi phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: chags pa dang / bzhad pa dang / gsung ba dang / dam tshig rnams kyis ni dbang gi phrin las mdzad do //
translated: The passionate, laughing, speaking, and committed perform the activity of power.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rin chen dang / 'khor lo dang / @199a * //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rin chen dang / 'khor lo dang / @199a * //
translated: The vajra being, jewel, wheel, and

original: las rnams kyis ni rgyas pa'i phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: las rnams kyis ni rgyas pa'i phrin las mdzad do //
translated: karma perform the activity of increase.

original: rdo rje legs pa dang / nyi ma dang / chos dang / srung ba rnams kyis ni zhi ba'i las mdzad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje legs pa dang / nyi ma dang / chos dang / srung ba rnams kyis ni zhi ba'i las mdzad pa nyid do //
translated: The excellent vajra, sun, Dharma, and protector perform the activity of pacification.

original: de dag gi mtshan dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las 'gro ba sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sku rnams yongs su spros pa ste
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las 'gro ba sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sku rnams yongs su spros pa ste
translated: Their names, colors, implements, and so forth are emanated bodies that are emanated from the natural luminosity of all phenomena in order to fully perfect all migrating sentient beings.

original: / de yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud le'u sum cu rtsa gsum pa las /
analyzed: / de yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud le'u sum cu rtsa gsum pa las /
translated: The thirty-three chapters of the Vairocana Tantra state:

translated: to dispel the hordes of darkness of ignorance, to endow them with the true words, to extract them from the swamp of afflictions, to establish them in the water of discipline, to cut the net of conceptuality,

translated: They are the ones who cause one to enter the realm of reality, who cause one to abide in the stage of the transcendent lords, who bestow the four kinds of success, who protect from the hosts of demons, who cut the net of cyclic life, and who bind the unvirtuous and sinful dharmas.

translated: They hold their own individual emblems, such as the vajra hook, because they bind the unvirtuous and sinful dharmas.

translated: In the context of the causal maṇḍala of the yogi/nī, they become the nature of the sixteen, such as Vajrasattva, through the sequence of the sixteen moments of mind.

translated: The mandala of the four mudras is as follows: Vajrasattva has four retinues, such as Vajra Pacifier, and so on; the king has four retinues, such as Samantabhadra, and so on; the passionate one has four retinues, such as Samanta­raśmi, and so on;🔽the good one has four retinues, such as Śāntimati, and so on; the jewel has four retinues, such as Bhadraśrī, and so on; the sun has four retinues, such as Bhadrapāla, and so on; the banner has four retinues, such as Mahābala, and so on;

original: bzhad pa la 'od bzang la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / rdo rje chos la rgyal ba'i tog la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / rnon po la rgyal ba'i blo gros la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / 'khor lo la dri med rgyal po la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang /
analyzed: bzhad pa la 'od bzang la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / rdo rje chos la rgyal ba'i tog la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / rnon po la rgyal ba'i blo gros la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang / 'khor lo la dri med rgyal po la sogs pa'i 'khor bzhi dang /
