analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu rgyan can nag po chen po'i steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: They have crowns of the tathāgatas and stand on seats of sun on top of Mahākāla.

original: 'khor lo gnyis pa'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi lcags kyu kha dog dkar po la zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo gnyis pa'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi lcags kyu kha dog dkar po la zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa /
translated: On the channel-wheel of two, one should draw the wrathful Kālarātri, white in color, with three faces and six arms.

original: zhal dang po dkar po g-yas nag po g-yon dmar por 'dug pa /
analyzed: zhal dang po dkar po g-yas nag po g-yon dmar por 'dug pa /
translated: The first face is white, the right is black, and the left is red.

original: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis lcags kyu dang rnga yab dang tho ba 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis lcags kyu dang rnga yab dang tho ba 'dzin pa /
translated: In his three right hands he holds a hook, a fly whisk, and a hammer.

original: g-yon pa gsum gyis sdigs mdzub dang tho ba dang thod pa 'dzin pa sangs rgyas kyi dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: g-yon pa gsum gyis sdigs mdzub dang tho ba dang thod pa 'dzin pa sangs rgyas kyi dbu rgyan can /
translated: In his three left hands he holds a threatening forefinger, a hammer, and a skull-cup. He has a crown of Buddhas.

original: 'jigs byed kyi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed kyi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: He stands on a sun seat on top of Bhairava.

original: 'khor lo gsum pa'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi zhags pa kha dog sngon po //
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum pa'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi zhags pa kha dog sngon po //
translated: On the spoke of the third wheel, one should draw the wrathful Kālarāga, who is blue in color.

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa la dang po sngo ba la g-yas pa dkar ba g-yon pa dmar ba /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa la dang po sngo ba la g-yas pa dkar ba g-yon pa dmar ba /
translated: He has three faces and six arms. His first face is blue, the right face is white, and the left face is red.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu rgyan can /🔽phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis zhags pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo @204b 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu rgyan can / phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis zhags pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo @204b 'dzin pa /
translated: He has a crown of the Tathāgatas.🔽In his three right hands he holds a noose, a sword, and a chakram.

original: g-yon pa gsum na dgra sta dang / rin po che dang thod pa 'dzin pa sgra gcan gyi steng na nyi ma'i dkyil na bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa gsum na dgra sta dang / rin po che dang thod pa 'dzin pa sgra gcan gyi steng na nyi ma'i dkyil na bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: In his three left hands he holds an axe, a jewel, and a skull-cup. He stands on a sun disc on top of Rāhu.

original: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i rtsar ni dus kyi 'ching byed kha dog dmar po la zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i rtsar ni dus kyi 'ching byed kha dog dmar po la zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa /
translated: On the channel of the fourth cakra, one should draw Kālarātri, red in color, with three faces and six arms.

original: zhal dang po dmar po g-yas dkar po g-yon nag por 'dug pa la /
analyzed: zhal dang po dmar po g-yas dkar po g-yon nag por 'dug pa la /
translated: Her first face is red, the right face is white, and the left face is black.

original: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis ral gri dang rdo rje dang lcags sgrog 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis ral gri dang rdo rje dang lcags sgrog 'dzin pa /
translated: With her three right hands she holds a sword, a vajra, and a chain.

original: g-yon pa gsum gyis mda' gzhu dang padma dang tho ba 'dzin cing 'od dpag med pa'i dbu rgyan can bde byed kyi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o//
analyzed: g-yon pa gsum gyis mda' gzhu dang padma dang tho ba 'dzin cing 'od dpag med pa'i dbu rgyan can bde byed kyi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o//
translated: With her three left hands she holds a bow and arrow, a lotus, and a hammer. She has a crown of Uṣṇīṣa-sitātapatrā, and she sits on a sun seat above the pleasure (śamkha).

original: 'khor lo dang po'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi chags pa kha dog ljang gu la dbu gsum phyag drug pa zhal dang po ljang gu g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang po'i rtsar ni khro bo dus kyi chags pa kha dog ljang gu la dbu gsum phyag drug pa zhal dang po ljang gu g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
translated: On the channel of the first cakra, one should draw the wrathful Kālarāga, green in color, with three faces and six arms. His first face is green, the right face is white, and the left face is red.

original: phyag g-yas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin cing sdigs mdzub mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin cing sdigs mdzub mdzad pa /
translated: With his right hands he holds a vajra cross and a bell and makes a threatening gesture.

original: g-yon pa gsum gyis 'khor lo dang tho ba dang thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa gsum gyis 'khor lo dang tho ba dang thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: With his three left hands he holds a wheel, a hammer, and a skull cup.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu rgyan can gar gyi dbang phyug gi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu rgyan can gar gyi dbang phyug gi steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa bri'o //
translated: He is adorned with the crown of the Tathāgatas, and sits on a sun seat on top of Nāṭyeśvara.

original: de'i zur bzhir ni mi ro'i steng na mchod pa'i khro mo pho nya'i tshogs dus kyi srin mo dang / dus kyi so can ma dang dus kyi mtshan mo dang / dus kyi gnod sbyin mo rnams zhal gcig pa la phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: de'i zur bzhir ni mi ro'i steng na mchod pa'i khro mo pho nya'i tshogs dus kyi srin mo dang / dus kyi so can ma dang dus kyi mtshan mo dang / dus kyi gnod sbyin mo rnams zhal gcig pa la phyag gnyis pa /
translated: In the four corners, on top of human corpses, are the four goddesses of offering, the wrathful messengers: Kālarātri, Kāladantī, Kālanandī, and Kālasarvā. They each have one face and two arms.

original: shin tu khro bo'i gzugs can g-yas na byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa g-yon pa na thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa skra kham pa gyen du 'phags pa /
analyzed: shin tu khro bo'i gzugs can g-yas na byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa g-yon pa na thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa skra kham pa gyen du 'phags pa /
translated: They are very wrathful, holding in their right hands a skull-cup filled with the five elixirs such as bodhicitta, and in their left hands a skull-cup filled with blood. Their tawny hair bristles upward.

original: mig 'bur ba 'jigs pa'i gzugs can rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mig 'bur ba 'jigs pa'i gzugs can rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Their bulging eyes are terrifying.

original: sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sgo ba rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sgo ba rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: At the gates are the gate-keepers such as the hook-bearer.

original: khro bo de dag thams cad kyang dbu skra kham pa gyen du 'phags pa /
analyzed: khro bo de dag thams cad kyang dbu skra kham pa gyen du 'phags pa /
translated: All of these wrathful ones have tawny hair bristling upward.

original: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
translated: He bares his fangs.

original: ha la ha la gu lu gu lu'i sgra sgrogs pa /
analyzed: ha la ha la gu lu gu lu'i sgra sgrogs pa /
translated: He utters the sound “hala hala” and “gula gula.”

original: mi mgo'i phreng bas sku la brgyan pa thod pa lngas dbu la brgyan pa stag gi pags pas smad dkris shing sbrul gyi chun po'i cod pan dang / rna cha dang / mgul rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / @205a * //
analyzed: mi mgo'i phreng bas sku la brgyan pa thod pa lngas dbu la brgyan pa stag gi pags pas smad dkris shing sbrul gyi chun po'i cod pan dang / rna cha dang / mgul rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / @205a * //
translated: His body is adorned with a garland of human heads and a tiara of five skulls. He is wrapped in a tiger skin and has a head ornament, earrings, necklace, armlets,

original: gdu bu dang / rkang gdub dang / ska rags dang / se ral khar thogs pa /
analyzed: gdu bu dang / rkang gdub dang / ska rags dang / se ral khar thogs pa /
translated: bangles, anklets, belt, and sash of snakes.

original: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs bri ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs bri ba ste /
translated: He has a terrifying form.

original: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs las yang dag par sprul par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs las yang dag par sprul par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are emanations from the mind of the Blessed Sugata Vairocana, Akshobhya, Vajrapani, and so forth.

original: dus kyi srin mo la sogs pa'i khro mo rnams ni sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi'i thugs kyi sprul par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi srin mo la sogs pa'i khro mo rnams ni sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi'i thugs kyi sprul par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the wrathful ones such as Kali the demoness are emanations from the mind of the four family mothers such as Buddha Lochana.

original: gdug pa'i tshogs thams cad ma lus par gdul ba'i phyir khro bo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gdug pa'i tshogs thams cad ma lus par gdul ba'i phyir khro bo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin zhing /
translated: In order to tame all the hosts of evildoers without exception, he displays the form of a wrathful one.

original: de nyid bde ba chen po'i ngo bo las byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba chen po'i ngo bo las byung ba nyid do //
translated: That itself arises from the essence of great bliss.

original: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol du ni dur khrod shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol du ni dur khrod shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs /
translated: Outside the celestial palace, there is a terrifying charnel ground,

original: ro langs dang ce sbyang dang / 'jigs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa dang / shing la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa'o //🔽de nas bdud rtsis gang ba yi //
analyzed: ro langs dang ce sbyang dang / 'jigs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa dang / shing la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa'o // de nas bdud rtsis gang ba yi //
translated: adorned with various terrifying forms such as zombies, hyenas, trees, and so on.🔽Then, place the sixteen vases

original: bum pa bcu drug gzhag par bya //🔽bdug pa me tog dri zhim dang // mar me dang ni bro snod dang // kha zas bkram pa'i gtor ma dang // bza' ba bca' ba bdud rtsi ches //
analyzed: bum pa bcu drug gzhag par bya // bdug pa me tog dri zhim dang // mar me dang ni bro snod dang // kha zas bkram pa'i gtor ma dang // bza' ba bca' ba bdud rtsi ches //
translated: filled with nectar.🔽Incense, fragrant flowers,🔽lamps, food vessels,🔽food offerings spread with edibles,

original: mgo thod gang bar gyur pa rnams //
analyzed: mgo thod gang bar gyur pa rnams //
translated: and the great nectar of food and drink🔽should be placed in the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni mang du gzhag / ces gsungs pa ste mchod pa'i tshogs bsags pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni mang du gzhag / ces gsungs pa ste mchod pa'i tshogs bsags pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: This teaches the accumulation of the host of offerings.

original: de la bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas gang bar gyur pa'i bum pa bcu gnyis sam bcu drug la sogs pa'i steng du sha chen la sogs pas gang bar gyur pa'i thod pa gzhag par bya ba dang / me tog dang / bdug ba dang / dri dang byug pa dang /
analyzed: de la bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas gang bar gyur pa'i bum pa bcu gnyis sam bcu drug la sogs pa'i steng du sha chen la sogs pas gang bar gyur pa'i thod pa gzhag par bya ba dang / me tog dang / bdug ba dang / dri dang byug pa dang /
translated: In that, one should place twelve or sixteen vases filled with the five elixirs, and on top of them, skull-cups filled with human flesh, and so forth.🔽One should fill it completely with all the articles of offering, such as flowers, incense, perfume, ointments,

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad kyis kun nas rgyas par bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa bza' ba'i tshogs la sogs pa mang bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad kyis kun nas rgyas par bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa bza' ba'i tshogs la sogs pa mang bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and lamps, and one should place there a great deal of food, and so forth, the wealth of the world.

original: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyis //
translated: Then, the master himself,

original: mgo thod phyag rgyas zhugs nas kyang //
analyzed: mgo thod phyag rgyas zhugs nas kyang //
translated: having entered with the skull-gesture,

original: phyag rgya de dang de yis ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya de dang de yis ni /
translated: with that and that gesture,

original: sha rnams kun gyi dam tshig gsol //
analyzed: sha rnams kun gyi dam tshig gsol //
translated: he should offer the pledge of all the meats.

original: de nas 'dod ldan rnyed nas ni //
analyzed: de nas 'dod ldan rnyed nas ni //
translated: Then, having obtained the desired,

original: h'um zhes bya bas sgrub @205b par byed //🔽de nas sngags pa sgo sgor yang //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya bas sgrub @205b par byed // de nas sngags pa sgo sgor yang //
translated: the adept should accomplish with the syllable hūṃ.🔽Then, the mantrin should approach

original: de nyid dran pas bsnyen par bya //
analyzed: de nyid dran pas bsnyen par bya //
translated: at each door, mindful of reality.

original: des ni nges par dngos grub ster //
analyzed: des ni nges par dngos grub ster //
translated: He will certainly grant spiritual powers.

original: yud tsam 'jig rten gsum dbang bskur //
analyzed: yud tsam 'jig rten gsum dbang bskur //
translated: For a moment, he consecrates the three worlds.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni tshogs rnams dang // rang gi lha yi tshogs rnams la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni tshogs rnams dang // rang gi lha yi tshogs rnams la //
translated: In the maṇḍala, to the assembly and to the assembly of one’s deities,

original: rgyud las byung ba'i dam tshig brjod //
analyzed: rgyud las byung ba'i dam tshig brjod //
translated: one should recite the commitments that arise from the tantras.

original: de nas mchod de langs nas kyang //🔽tshogs mchod rdo rje sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: de nas mchod de langs nas kyang // tshogs mchod rdo rje sems dpa' yi //
translated: Then, having made offerings and arisen,🔽one should perform the gaṇacakra,

original: tshul du gnas pa dbyung bar bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: tshul du gnas pa dbyung bar bya // zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: and emerge in the manner of Vajrasattva.

original: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the process of one’s own entry into the maṇḍala.

original: de la thod pa'i rgyan la sogs pas brgyan nas gong du gsungs pa'i phyag rgya bcas te 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thod pa'i rgyan la sogs pas brgyan nas gong du gsungs pa'i phyag rgya bcas te 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Adorned with the ornaments of the skull cup, and so on, one should enter, having made the above-mentioned mudras.

original: de nas bdag nyid khro bo'i tshogs rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang mnos nas gnang ba thob par gyur pa dang / thod pa'i phyag rgya bcas pas bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid khro bo'i tshogs rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang mnos nas gnang ba thob par gyur pa dang / thod pa'i phyag rgya bcas pas bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken the empowerment in the proper order from the assembly of wrathful ones, and having obtained permission, one should make offerings with the commitments, such as the five elixirs, and so on, having made the mudra of the skull cup.

original: de nas bdag nyid khro bo rdo rje me'i nyi mar bsams la snying gar h'um bsam zhing /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid khro bo rdo rje me'i nyi mar bsams la snying gar h'um bsam zhing /
translated: Then, one should imagine oneself as the wrathful Vajra Sun, and imagine a hūṃ at the heart.

original: de las gyur pa'i thugs ka'i rdo rje dang gnyis su med par byas la dag par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bya'o //
analyzed: de las gyur pa'i thugs ka'i rdo rje dang gnyis su med par byas la dag par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bya'o //
translated: From that, one should perform the yoga of purification, having made it nondual with the vajra at the heart.

original: de nas sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dgug pa dang gzhug pa la sogs pa byas te aarghas mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dgug pa dang gzhug pa la sogs pa byas te aarghas mchod nas /
translated: Then, one should summon the gnosis maṇḍala with the yoga of the hook and so on at the doors, and having made offerings with argha and so on,

original: slob ma la dam tshig gi tshigs su bcad pa sngar gsungs pa rnams bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma la dam tshig gi tshigs su bcad pa sngar gsungs pa rnams bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: one should proclaim to the disciples the previously mentioned verses of the sacred pledges.

original: de'i rjes la bdag nyid sngar gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas slob ma la dbang bskur bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bdag nyid sngar gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas slob ma la dbang bskur bar bya ba ni /
translated: After that, one should confer empowerment on the disciples with the previously mentioned yoga.

original: de nas slob ma bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: de nas slob ma bsdus nas ni //
translated: Then, having gathered the disciples,

original: lag na rin chen thogs te gzhug / aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya h'um /
analyzed: lag na rin chen thogs te gzhug / aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya h'um /
translated: one should cause them to enter, holding a jewel in their hand, with oṃ vajra āveśaya aḥ.

original: aom badzra r'aksha si phat /
analyzed: aom badzra r'aksha si phat /
translated: oṃ vajra rakṣa si phaṭ

original: aom badzra kro dh'a na l'arka spu ra pra t'itstsha h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dh'a na l'arka spu ra pra t'itstsha h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra krodha nātha sphoṭa pracaṭa hūṃ

original: aom badzra kro dha ai kshe h'um p'a sha phat /🔽aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya pi pa h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha ai kshe h'um p'a sha phat / aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya pi pa h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-krodha iṣe hūṃ paca phaṭ.🔽Oṃ vajra-krodha samaya piba hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya m'a ti kra ma h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya m'a ti kra ma h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-krodha samaya mātaṅga-krama hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra kro dha rid sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha rid sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-krodha riṣi samaya abhiṣiñca hūṃ phaṭ.🔽By this empowerment one should be empowered, just as it is taught.

original: 'dis dbang bskur la de bzhin du dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa gsungs pa ste /🔽de la slob @206a * //
analyzed: 'dis dbang bskur la de bzhin du dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa gsungs pa ste / de la slob @206a * //
translated: This is the entry of the disciple into the maṇḍala.

original: ma ras la sogs pas mig bkab la /
analyzed: ma ras la sogs pas mig bkab la /
translated: There, the disciple, with eyes covered by a cloth,

original: rin po che la sogs pa thogs su bcug ste /
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa thogs su bcug ste /
translated: having been made to hold a jewel, etc.,

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas nas sngags dang bos ni gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas nas sngags dang bos ni gzhug par bya'o //
translated: having confessed his sins, etc., in the proper sequence, should be caused to enter with the mantra and the name.

original: gnyis pas ni brtan par bya'o ;
analyzed: gnyis pas ni brtan par bya'o ;
translated: By the second, one should stabilize.

original: / gsum pas ni me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gsum pas ni me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: By the third, one should cast the flower.

original: bzhi pas ni mig dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni mig dbye bar bya'o //
translated: By the fourth, one should open the eyes.

original: lnga pas ni thod pa'i khrag la aom badzra kro dha aa mri ta aa mri tod bha ba h'um zhes pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te dam tshig gi chu blud bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni thod pa'i khrag la aom badzra kro dha aa mri ta aa mri tod bha ba h'um zhes pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te dam tshig gi chu blud bar bya'o //
translated: With the fifth, one should give the pledge water, having enchanted the blood in the skull with the mantra “Oṃ vajra-crooked one, be the water of gnosis, hūṃ!” one hundred and eight times.

original: drug pas ni dam tshig bsgrag pa'i sngags so //

analyzed: de nas h'um gi tshogs bzhag la //

translated: one cubit or two cubits,

original: / mi yi rgyal mchog rnams kyi nyis 'gyur tshad //
analyzed: / mi yi rgyal mchog rnams kyi nyis 'gyur tshad //
translated: double the size of the supreme king of men.

original: de dag rim par legs shing mdzes byas la //
analyzed: de dag rim par legs shing mdzes byas la //
translated: Having well made them in order and beautiful,

original: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the burnt offering ritual.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gong du gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg ni tshe 'das pa'i ched du gsungs la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gong du gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg ni tshe 'das pa'i ched du gsungs la /
translated: The burnt offering taught above by Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi is for the sake of the deceased.

original: 'di ni 'tsho ba da lta ba la thun mong du gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'tsho ba da lta ba la thun mong du gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is said to be common to the present life.

original: de la dang por zhi ba'i thab khung rab 'bring tha ma gsum ni khru gang ba dang do pa dang bzhi par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang por zhi ba'i thab khung rab 'bring tha ma gsum ni khru gang ba dang do pa dang bzhi par bya ba ste /
translated: Among them, first, the peaceful hearth is of three kinds: best, middling, and least, which are one cubit, one and a half cubits, and two cubits, respectively.

original: de yang rigs kyi bye brag gis mtshon pa ni rgyal rigs la @208a * //
analyzed: de yang rigs kyi bye brag gis mtshon pa ni rgyal rigs la @208a * //
translated: Moreover, the distinctions of the family are indicated by the family of the king,

original: sogs pa la sbyar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa la sbyar ro //
translated: and so forth.

original: de shin tu legs shing mdzes par bya ba ni zur la sogs pa kha dog gi khyad par gyis legs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de shin tu legs shing mdzes par bya ba ni zur la sogs pa kha dog gi khyad par gyis legs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is very well made and beautiful, well made with the distinctions of color, such as the corners, and so forth.

original: 'khor lo'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi //
translated: On top of the wheel, in the middle of a moon maṇḍala,

original: dbus su rdo rje rtse lngar gyur ba cig /'od zer dkar po'i phreng ba'i gzi can la //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje rtse lngar gyur ba cig /'od zer dkar po'i phreng ba'i gzi can la //
translated: there is a five-pronged vajra, blazing with a garland of white light rays.

original: phyag rgya'i tshogs rnams thams cad bri bya ste //🔽byams pa la sogs phyag mtshan zur bzhir bri //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i tshogs rnams thams cad bri bya ste // byams pa la sogs phyag mtshan zur bzhir bri //
translated: One should draw all the assemblies of the seals.🔽Draw the signs of the hand implements of Maitreya, and so forth, in the four corners.

original: rgyal po bzhi yi ji bzhin phyag mtshan dang // phyogs kyi bdag po de bzhin phyogs bri //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi yi ji bzhin phyag mtshan dang // phyogs kyi bdag po de bzhin phyogs bri //
translated: Draw the signs of the hand implements of the four kings, and likewise, the directions.

original: khyab 'jug la sogs lha chen phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: khyab 'jug la sogs lha chen phyag rgya rnams //
translated: The great gods such as Vishnu, and so forth,

original: 'khor lo lta bu nyid du bri bar bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo lta bu nyid du bri bar bya //
translated: should be drawn in the form of their seals.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni phyag rgya'i tshogs bri ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni phyag rgya'i tshogs bri ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stating that the assembly of seals should be drawn.

original: de la thab khung gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa dkar po bris nas /
analyzed: de la thab khung gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa dkar po bris nas /
translated: In the center of the hearth, draw a white wheel with sixteen spokes.

original: de'i dbus su rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i phyag rgya zla ba'i steng du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i phyag rgya zla ba'i steng du bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, draw the seals of the five Tathagatas such as the vajra, and so forth, upon a moon.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo'i rtsibs la ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang / de'i mu ran gyi phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu rtsa gnyis pa la byams pa la sogs pa bcu drug dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa lha mo bcu drug gi phyag rgya bri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo'i rtsibs la ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang / de'i mu ran gyi phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu rtsa gnyis pa la byams pa la sogs pa bcu drug dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa lha mo bcu drug gi phyag rgya bri'o //
translated: In the same way, on the spokes of the wheel, draw the seals of Vajrasattva and so forth, and on the outer rim of the wheel with thirty-two spokes, draw the seals of the sixteen goddesses such as Maitreya and so forth, and the sixteen goddesses such as Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo drug cu rtsa bzhi pa la rgyal po chen po bzhi dang lha chen po bzhi chung ma dang bcas pa dang / phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' chen po brgyad dang / klu chen po brgyad dang / rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams bri bar bya ba nyid do //🔽dri zhim chus bkang kha dog dkar bsgyur la //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo drug cu rtsa bzhi pa la rgyal po chen po bzhi dang lha chen po bzhi chung ma dang bcas pa dang / phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' chen po brgyad dang / klu chen po brgyad dang / rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams bri bar bya ba nyid do // dri zhim chus bkang kha dog dkar bsgyur la //
translated: Outside of that, on a sixty-four-spoked wheel, one should draw the seals of the four great kings, the four great gods together with their wives, the ten direction protectors, the eight great planets, the eight great nāgas, the twenty-eight lunar mansions, and so forth.🔽Eight vases filled with fragrant water and dyed white

original: dkar pos legs par dkris pa'i bum pa brgyad //
analyzed: dkar pos legs par dkris pa'i bum pa brgyad //
translated: and well wrapped in white🔽, three white filled bali cakes, and🔽incense, lamps, and flowers should be placed.🔽For the sake of making offerings, one should place canopies,🔽parasols, victory banners, streamers, and so forth.

original: dkar gsum gang ba'i gtor ma lha bshos dang // bdug pa mar me me tog rnams kyang gzhag / mchod par bya ba'i phyir ni bla re dang // gdugs dang rgyal mtshan rnga yab la sogs gzhag / ces gsungs pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad gsungs pa ste de la bum pa kha dog dkar po la gos dkar pos dkris pa brgyad gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: dkar gsum gang ba'i gtor ma lha bshos dang // bdug pa mar me me tog rnams kyang gzhag / mchod par bya ba'i phyir ni bla re dang // gdugs dang rgyal mtshan rnga yab la sogs gzhag / ces gsungs pa ni mchod pa'i yo byad gsungs pa ste de la bum pa kha dog dkar po la gos dkar pos dkris pa brgyad gzhag pa dang /
translated: This teaches the offering articles. Therein, one should place eight white vases wrapped in white cloth,

original: zho dang mar dang 'o ma la @208b sogs pas sbyar ba'i lha bshos dang / gtor ma 'byor tshad du gzhag pa dang / gdugs dang bla re la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad sna tshogs pa dang spos dang me tog la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i longs spyod ci 'byor pa gzhag par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zho dang mar dang 'o ma la @208b sogs pas sbyar ba'i lha bshos dang / gtor ma 'byor tshad du gzhag pa dang / gdugs dang bla re la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad sna tshogs pa dang spos dang me tog la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i longs spyod ci 'byor pa gzhag par bya ba nyid do //
translated: One should set out various offering articles such as curd, butter, milk, and so on, as well as sacrificial cakes, and as many ritual tormas as one can afford, and also parasols, canopies, and so on, as well as various worldly enjoyments such as incense and flowers.

original: nang re ga bur dri zhim sna tshogs dang // tsandan la sogs byug pas lus byugs la //
analyzed: nang re ga bur dri zhim sna tshogs dang // tsandan la sogs byug pas lus byugs la //
translated: One should anoint one’s body with ointments of camphor and various sweet scents,

original: kha ni shar phyogs bltas te sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: kha ni shar phyogs bltas te sbyin sreg bya //
translated: and facing east, one should perform the burnt offering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan la 'dug bya'am //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan la 'dug bya'am //
translated: One should sit on the seat of the Tathāgata,

original: yang na rnal 'byor ldan pas sems dpa'i gdan 'dug ste //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ldan pas sems dpa'i gdan 'dug ste //
translated: or else, the practitioner should sit on the seat of the bodhisattva.

original: gos dang phreng mchog dkar pos brgyan par bya //
analyzed: gos dang phreng mchog dkar pos brgyan par bya //
translated: One should adorn oneself with the best white garlands and garments.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: This teaches the perfection of oneself.

original: de la sbyin sreg 'bum ma them gyi bar du nang par re re ga bur la sogs pas lus byugs pa dang / gong du bstan pa'i rnal 'byor phun sum tshogs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la sbyin sreg 'bum ma them gyi bar du nang par re re ga bur la sogs pas lus byugs pa dang / gong du bstan pa'i rnal 'byor phun sum tshogs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: In this regard, one should perform a hundred thousand oblations, anointing one's body with camphor, etc. each morning, and one should perform the yoga as previously described.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan la 'dug pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa 'dug pa ni seng ge'i khri'i steng ngam yang na rnal 'byor gyis padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa bsams pa la 'dug par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan la 'dug pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa 'dug pa ni seng ge'i khri'i steng ngam yang na rnal 'byor gyis padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa bsams pa la 'dug par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Sitting on the seat of the Tathagata, etc. means that one should sit on a lion throne or else on a sixteen-petaled lotus imagined through yoga.🔽Ghee, milk, honey, porridge of barley, etc.,🔽sesame, ghee, sugar,🔽mustard seed, parched grain,🔽rice, barley, wheat,

original: mar dang 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang // nas kyi thug pa la sogs dang // til dang mar dang kha ra dang // yungs kar dang ni 'bras yos dang // 'bras chan nas dang gro rnams dang // me tog shin tu dri zhim rnams //
analyzed: mar dang 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang // nas kyi thug pa la sogs dang // til dang mar dang kha ra dang // yungs kar dang ni 'bras yos dang // 'bras chan nas dang gro rnams dang // me tog shin tu dri zhim rnams //
translated: flowers with very sweet fragrance,

original: ga bur dang ni bsres nas kyang //
analyzed: ga bur dang ni bsres nas kyang //
translated: mixed with camphor,🔽and anointed with white sandalwood,

original: tsandan dkar pos bsgos pa dang // 'dab bdun me tog 'bras bur bcas //
analyzed: tsandan dkar pos bsgos pa dang // 'dab bdun me tog 'bras bur bcas //
translated: with seven petals and fruit.

original: zho dang ldan pa'i yam shing ni //
analyzed: zho dang ldan pa'i yam shing ni //
translated: Fuel sticks with curd,

original: de dag khung bu'i khyad par las //
analyzed: de dag khung bu'i khyad par las //
translated: The size of the fire pit is determined by the type of rite.

original: rang gi sor gyis gzhal bya ba //
analyzed: rang gi sor gyis gzhal bya ba //
translated: It should be measured with one's own hand.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi yan chad mchog / sor mo bcu drug bar ma ste //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi yan chad mchog / sor mo bcu drug bar ma ste //
translated: Twenty-four finger breadths is the best, sixteen is medium,

original: tha ma bcu gnyis nyid du bshad //
analyzed: tha ma bcu gnyis nyid du bshad //
translated: and twelve is said to be the least.

original: shin tu chung na sor brgyad de //🔽bud shing zho dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: shin tu chung na sor brgyad de // bud shing zho dang ldan pa la //
translated: If it is very small, it should be eight finger breadths.🔽The fuel should be mixed with curd,

original: dri chus bskus par shes par bya //
analyzed: dri chus bskus par shes par bya //
translated: and it should be sprinkled with urine.

original: zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: sreg rdzas rnams gsungs pa ste //🔽de la sreg pa'i rdzas gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / nas kyi thug pa zho dang @209a * //
analyzed: sreg rdzas rnams gsungs pa ste // de la sreg pa'i rdzas gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / nas kyi thug pa zho dang @209a * //
translated: The articles for the fire offering are mentioned.

original: sbyar ba dang / til dkar po dang / yungs kar dkar po dang / me tog dkar po dang / la du ba dang / mngar gsum dang / 'bras yos la sogs pa dang ga bur dang tsandan gyis bsgos pa gzhag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sbyar ba dang / til dkar po dang / yungs kar dkar po dang / me tog dkar po dang / la du ba dang / mngar gsum dang / 'bras yos la sogs pa dang ga bur dang tsandan gyis bsgos pa gzhag par bya ba dang /
translated: The articles for the fire offering are as mentioned above: butter, honey, barley gruel mixed with curd, white sesame seeds, white mustard seeds, white flowers, camphor, the three sweets, parched rice, and so on, and those perfumed with camphor and sandalwood.

original: yam shing ni me spor bar byed pa ste de ba da ru'am kha dog dkar zhing 'o ma dang ldan pa rnams la khung bu rab la ni sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / 'bring la ni bcu drug dang / tha ma la ni bcu gnyis dang brgyad du bya ba ste /
analyzed: yam shing ni me spor bar byed pa ste de ba da ru'am kha dog dkar zhing 'o ma dang ldan pa rnams la khung bu rab la ni sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / 'bring la ni bcu drug dang / tha ma la ni bcu gnyis dang brgyad du bya ba ste /
translated: The sacrificial ladle is the fire-kindling wood, which is white, milky, and of the shape of a sword-point. The best is twenty-four fingerbreadths long, the middling sixteen, the least twelve or eight.

original: de las thung ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rdzas su rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las thung ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rdzas su rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Shorter than that is not suitable for the yogic substance.

original: de dag kyang dbyibs ni rtse mo ral gri ltar byas la rtsa bzlum por bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbyibs ni rtse mo ral gri ltar byas la rtsa bzlum por bya ba nyid do //
translated: The shape is made like a sword-point, and the root is made round.

original: bud shing ni ka ma la sogs pa kha dog dkar zhing 'o ma dang 'bras bur ldan pa la ga bur la sogs bas bsgre bar byas bas zlum po nyid du brtsig par bya'o //
analyzed: bud shing ni ka ma la sogs pa kha dog dkar zhing 'o ma dang 'bras bur ldan pa la ga bur la sogs bas bsgre bar byas bas zlum po nyid du brtsig par bya'o //
translated: The fuel is white, milky, and fruitful, such as the jasmine tree, and is to be piled up in a round shape, anointed with camphor, etc.

original: bud shing de las byung ba'i me //
analyzed: bud shing de las byung ba'i me //
translated: The fire that arises from that fuel

original: sbar nas dri chus gtor nas ni //
analyzed: sbar nas dri chus gtor nas ni //
translated: is ignited and sprinkled with urine.🔽The white lotus is like the face, virtuous,

original: padma dkar po zhal 'dra dge / padma nor bu ril ba thogs //
analyzed: padma dkar po zhal 'dra dge / padma nor bu ril ba thogs //
translated: holding a lotus, jewel, and water pot,

original: lag pa gza' skar mchog thogs pa //
analyzed: lag pa gza' skar mchog thogs pa //
translated: holding the supreme planets and stars in the hands,🔽with the form of a sixteen-year-old.

original: padma dkar po'i gdan steng 'dug //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i gdan steng 'dug //
translated: He sits on a seat of a white lotus.

original: de lta'i me lha bkug nas kyang //
analyzed: de lta'i me lha bkug nas kyang //
translated: Having summoned the fire god in this way,

original: aargha blangs te dbul bar bya ;
analyzed: aargha blangs te dbul bar bya ;
translated: one should take the argha and offer it.

original: / zhes gsungs pa ni las kyi me lha spyan drang ba ste /
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pa ni las kyi me lha spyan drang ba ste /
translated: This is the invocation of the fire god of action.

original: de la dang por rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros pas las kyi me sbar bar bya ba'i phyir las kyi me lha drang srong chen po kha dog dkar dmar du 'dug pa /
analyzed: de la dang por rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros pas las kyi me sbar bar bya ba'i phyir las kyi me lha drang srong chen po kha dog dkar dmar du 'dug pa /
translated: First, light rays emanate from the seed syllable in one's heart, and in order to ignite the fire of action, the fire god of action is invited. The great sage has a red-colored body.

original: zhi ba'i cha lugs can lag pa bzhi pa la g-yas pa gnyis na gzar bu dang padma'i steng na rin po che thogs pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i cha lugs can lag pa bzhi pa la g-yas pa gnyis na gzar bu dang padma'i steng na rin po che thogs pa /
translated: He has the accouterments of a peaceful deity and four arms. In the two right hands he holds a ladle and a lotus with a jewel on top.

original: g-yon pa gnyis kyis ril pa spyi blugs dang / bgrang phreng thogs pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa gnyis kyis ril pa spyi blugs dang / bgrang phreng thogs pa /
translated: In the two left hands he holds a water jar and a rosary.

original: ra skyes kyi steng na padma dkar po'i gdan la bzhugs ba spyan drangs la aargha phul nas me sbar nas shar lho mtshams su bzhugs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: ra skyes kyi steng na padma dkar po'i gdan la bzhugs ba spyan drangs la aargha phul nas me sbar nas shar lho mtshams su bzhugs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: He sits on a white lotus seat on a ram, and after he is invited and the argha is offered, the fire is ignited and he is requested to sit in the southeast.

original: de nas zla rgyas dkar po la //
analyzed: de nas zla rgyas dkar po la //
translated: Then, on a full white moon,

original: bzhugs pa'i 'gro phan spyan drangs te //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i 'gro phan spyan drangs te //
translated: Having invited the one who benefits beings to remain,

original: padma'i steng du shar phyogs su //
analyzed: padma'i steng du shar phyogs su //
translated: on a lotus in the east,

original: bsams te brtan par bzhugs par bya //
analyzed: bsams te brtan par bzhugs par bya //
translated: one should imagine him and make him remain firm.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi me lha spyan drangs ba gsungs @209b ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi me lha spyan drangs ba gsungs @209b ba ste /
translated: This is the invitation of the wisdom fire god.

original: de yang rang gi sa bon las 'od zer spros pas khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba padma'i steng na zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa sku mdog dkar po dang phyag mtshan gong du gsungs pa spyan drangs nas shar phyogs su bzhugs par bsam pa nyid do
analyzed: de yang rang gi sa bon las 'od zer spros pas khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba padma'i steng na zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa sku mdog dkar po dang phyag mtshan gong du gsungs pa spyan drangs nas shar phyogs su bzhugs par bsam pa nyid do
translated: Furthermore, having invited the wrathful Three Realms Vanquisher, who is seated on a lotus and moon seat, white in color and with the hand implements as described above, having emanated light rays from one's seed syllable, one should imagine him to be seated in the east.

original: // de ltar bsams nas de nas ni //
analyzed: // de ltar bsams nas de nas ni //
translated: Having imagined him in that way, then

original: bsgrub bya rtag tu mdun bzhag ste //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rtag tu mdun bzhag ste //
translated: one should always place the one to be accomplished in front

original: de yi nyes pa drangs nas ni //
analyzed: de yi nyes pa drangs nas ni //
translated: and having drawn out his faults,

original: shin tu bsrings te spar bar bya //
analyzed: shin tu bsrings te spar bar bya //
translated: one should extend them and burn them.

original: nang par sngar ni mtshan byas nas //
analyzed: nang par sngar ni mtshan byas nas //
translated: Having performed the ablutions in the morning,

original: dri zhim chu yis lus byugs la //
analyzed: dri zhim chu yis lus byugs la //
translated: one should anoint one's body with fragrant water

original: bdud rtsi bzhin bsams sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: bdud rtsi bzhin bsams sbyin sreg bya //
translated: and imagine it to be nectar and perform the burnt offering.

original: zhes ba ni rnal 'byor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes ba ni rnal 'byor ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the yoga.

original: de la gang gi bsgrub par bya ba de mdun du dmigs pa de'i nyes pa nad la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis me'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: de la gang gi bsgrub par bya ba de mdun du dmigs pa de'i nyes pa nad la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis me'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: The faults of the one to be accomplished, such as disease, are placed in the fire of meditative concentration in front of the visualization of that one.

original: aom aagha ye zhes pa dang / aom ti bi sh'akya buddha si zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis mar khu blugs te me sbar bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: aom aagha ye zhes pa dang / aom ti bi sh'akya buddha si zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis mar khu blugs te me sbar bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: With the mantra Om aghaye, Om tibhishakya buddhasi, and so on, ghee is poured and the fire is ignited.

original: nang par sngar ni gtsang byas la //🔽zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi skabs su lus khrus byas la dri yis lus byugs nas /
analyzed: nang par sngar ni gtsang byas la // zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi skabs su lus khrus byas la dri yis lus byugs nas /
translated: Having purified oneself in the morning,🔽having bathed the body and anointed the body with perfume,

original: rdzas rnams bdud rtsir byin gyis brlabs nas bsreg par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rdzas rnams bdud rtsir byin gyis brlabs nas bsreg par bya ba nyid do //
translated: one should consecrate the substances as nectar and make the burnt offering.🔽This pledge is the supreme of actions:

original: dam tshig 'di ni las kyi mchog / lha rdzas bdud rtsi bro lnga 'dis //
